text: Chef's Burger Bistro, I was pleasantly surprised!!  The groupon deal was well worth it.  You can pick almost any burger, any wine/beer, and any hot/cold appetizer other than the seafood ones.  Our bill should have been over 75 dollars but I think I paid 30.  The service was great, the food came out piping hot and delicious.  Portion size was on point and you can get any wine/beer.  I'm not going to lie I definitely had a 13 dollar wine :). I would recommend this place without hesitation, the only reason I dock one point because it did take a while for our food to come out.

UPDATE - CLOSING Aug. 19, 2016 Chef's Burger Bistro would like to thank our patrons and friends for your continuous support during the last few years. As of August 19, 2016 we have officially closed our doors. We enjoyed providing our best for you during so many great events, lunches, dinner and happy hour. We greatly appreciate your patronage!
Most awesome burger!  Got mine with Goat Cheese and Bacon.  Plus the delicious homemade onion rings as a chill side.  Extremely satisfying! Great bar scene too.  Upstairs is hopping in the evening.

Bland & Disappointing... Great service though. I dined solo. The decor and patio makes this places very inviting and the service didn't disappoint, everyone was friendly and I was seated promptly. Burger - bison burger w/truffle fries. The burger was "ok". It lacked a distinct taste and lacked flavor. I didn't like the grilled onions on the bottom.  The fries were bland and tasteless.  For a place that looks so nice, in such a prime location, the food should be the best in the city. It was not. Far greater burger and fries at Au Cheval, Butcher and the Burger, or Lockdown. This place should just be a bar, it would be better for that.

Great spot for people watching inside or out!  Food is outstanding,  whatever you choose will be a great choice.  The bartenders are very helpful and friendly,  they especially know the wine list which is filled with exceptional  wines from some of the best regions  around the world.
Good food, good service. Couldn't have asked for a better experience! Definitely a must-visit if you're just coming through Chicago or visiting for the week!

Went there on a weekday afternoon and it was a nice experience. Our waiter could have been a little more attentive, we had to look for someone twice to bring the lemons we ordered because the waiter had obviously forgotten and some hot sauce.  I got the Mac and cheese burger, it was yummy but the important part is that the burger patties are amazingggg. My boyfriend got the American burger and absolutely loved it. Delicious burger patties! My fries were good but my Cole slaw didn't look too fresh..  The outdoor patio is nice and it wasnt busy that day so we took our time, it's a great place for burgers. We will definitely go again.  P.s. the "grill cheese" is not good! Steer clear! Break was super hard and barely had and cheese. It was stale-ish..

Came here with a friend using the groupon deal: 2 beers or wine + 1 appetizer (except oysters) + 2 burgers (any minus the double stack and bison burger) + side to split. We had read a previous review that customers had immediately experienced bad service once they showed their waiter they had a groupon, but we encountered no such thing. Our waiter seemed familiar with the groupon and provided us with great service.  We split the Cobb salad (delicious) and both had the crab burger (so yummy! And the bun was buttery and addicting). Our side was the truffle fries (very addicting!). We had a taste of dessert and chose the skillet cookie - YUMMMMMMMM! Best part of our dinner! Overall this was a VERY good meal and we got it at such a deal - but I had such a positive experience I will be coming back again! This place also has a nice little patio area that made for a bonus with our delicious meal.

Stopped here for a burger and had a pretty good experience. We got the bbq flatbread as an app: spicy, cheesy, full of bacon- ok, yum. My husband got the traditional American burger; it was topped with Mac and cheese, bacon and cheddar. I got the pulled pork. Both were satisfying and prepared to perfection. The service lacked a little luster. It wasn't bad by any means but I felt as though we were nicer to the waiter then he was to us :/ I'm way more in apt to return to a place I received awesome service. Good burgers are a dime a dozen, service seems to becoming a rarity.   Maybe an off day?

The food was pretty good. But, the burgers don't come with fries unless you go for lunch. The fries are $3, and you don't get that many.  Requiring fries to be purchased separately from the burger is a scam. We also had the taco appetizer. That was good, but a bit too expensive for the size of them. The waitress was bad. Didn't take care of us.

Overrall a good experience. The Bistro Burger is just okay. The patty was tasty but the burger looked as if it had been dipped in a sauce because as I tried to eat it, it was soggy and all over the place.  The truffle fries though... AMAZING. get those but the burgers were just meh.

Tried this place for the first time today at lunch time after hearing great things from family members. Went with the Groupon and very quickly saw customer service decline rapidly after the gentleman realized we had a Groupon.  My husband waited 15 minutes for his beer to arrive. Not to mention our order showed up in an order that would surprise you: Burgers first, no fries with them and our appetizer toward the end. And our server was hardly around and when he was, he had such an attitude it made the whole experience that much less desirable.  Lastly, the Groupon stated we get two beers or wine, so me being pregnant I ordered tea and my husband was going to take the 2 beers, assuming we'd pay for the tea separately. When we brought it up to the server, when we finally got his attention, he mentioned we already ordered our 2 drinks. Come on, guy, don't try and pull that on us. At least give us the option. And on that note, he wasn't entirely honest about what items we could and couldn't order with the Groupon because our family came previously with the same Groupon and weren't as limited as we were.  We never received a check because our Groupon covered the meal so I don't know the servers name and trying to break our $20 bill to leave a tip was maddening, no one is attentive to customer service in this restaurant. Husband waited 10 minutes at the bar to get change all the while the bartender is ignoring him while flirting with other patrons. Would have asked our server but again, he was no where to be seen. Very souring experience.
Kick ass burger. Held together on the bun. Moist and yummy. Onion rings were great too. Hit this place!

Great happy hour M-F. 50 cent wings, 1/2 off flatbread, and $2 burger sliders. I had the Naples flatbread and it was so delicious but not very filling so I would order something else as well.  I also had their chicken sandwich. It tasted a little too oily/buttery for me. There is a big kick of pesto as well. It was pretty good though. The chicken was good quality and was served in pieces (which I prefer) rather than a whole chicken breast.  The service was fantastic, very attentive and nice. The 3 people I encountered were very warm and welcoming.  The decor inside is very hip. They also have a nice outdoor patio.

We had a really good meal here. We all had a variety and no one had a bad meal.  My son said the Chicago dogs were good with his milk shake.  I had the BPBJ burger. A burger with Brie, a slice of pork belly topped with a peanut butter and jellied bun. A side of crispy onion rings topped it off just right. It was busy but not bad for mid day on a holiday weekend in Chicago.  Just a little on the pricier side but worth it for something different.

The burgers and other foods here were quite good. I ordered a burger with pork belly confit and some sort of peanut butter and jelly inspiration. It was delicious and cooked perfectly. The beer selection was good. I enjoyed an old Rasputin first and then the server accidentally brought me a founders stout second. They were both delicious with the food.  They had a nice array of TVs tuned to the Copa semi final and other European soccer. Nice trendy sports atmosphere.

Great service, great hamburger, and great patio area!  They have a killer happy hour menu but sadly, I missed it.  I was craving a good burger and got the bistro burger and it hit the spot!  Juicy and well seasoned - terrific place to grab a bite and enjoy Chicago!
Food was great. Service didn't start out great for how empty it was but impoved. We had the hot dogs, American burger, and Salmon. We were all happy with the food.

Horrible customer service. First time in Chicago, looking for a place to eat so we stumbled upon this place, bad idea. We got seated right away, but ended up leaving 20 minutes later because NO ONE acknowledged us. The server finally asked if everything was OK but we were already leaving. I can understand if it was busy but come on. Never again. Diners beware!
For some reason they couldn't make a medium buger. Sent the first burger back and second burger came back more cooked than the first one.

A great balance of sophistication and after work landing joint! The food is delicious and creative, especially when accompanied by one of the several choices of imported beer.  The staff are excellent, accommodating and really understand the importance of creating an inviting atmosphere. I wish this place was a bit bigger...tables can fill up quickly, although, if they're full, there's always the bar!

Simple food like burgers and fries should never be terrible. On top of it looks like the restaurant is understaffed so the server was inattentive. We ordered some beer and food. The server gave us the wrong beer and charged us for the higher priced beer. The food was cold and greasy. This place is way over priced for the quality food we got.

Went there with a big group (15), including some kids for a very early dinner.  We didn't have a reservation, but they opened  a private room thinking that was easiest.  Excellent service- some of the friendliest staff I've encountered.  They are stronger at cocktails than beer, but both were great.  Food was great too.  Def recommend.
Flavorless oysters, bland burgers and onion rings drenched in oil..Awful place to be!

When you spend $13 for a burger and you are charged $3.00 for a tiny bowl of fries, not a good deal. And we were charged a buck extra to not have spice on the chicken sandwich ?? Come on, man! Patio was very noisy ...all in for $50, not worth it
Best Happy Hour ever! Revolution Anti Hero for $4? 2, please. Wings not the best, but good! Nice servers too!

Probably one of the burgers I've had in a while, burger  proportions  were spot on, ordered a side of fries since they aren't included with the burger. At first I was a upset at the small portion, but by the time I was done I realized the portion was more than adequate.  I had the bistro burger medium well with guda and bacon.

My meal and experience was amazing. I got the bbq flat bread it was SERIOUSLY FANTASTIC! if I went again if get that in a heart bead. My girls split their chicken sandwich I personally didn't like the look of it but I'm talking only about me meal. Drinks were great service was also great we sat outside it was beautiful out. I will be back next time I'm in the area.
Macaroni and cheese, fried egg, bacon, and cheese sauce in a burger made my first night in Chicago co comfortable. Nice sports bar setting and great service, I'll go again.

My husband and I were in the middle for a burger after the Architecture Tour.   Waking toward Michigan Ave we popped into Burger Bistro.  Everything stared off great.   We were greeted right away, water glades filled and shortly after the server came to our table.   Glass of Sprite and and an iced tea ( asked for lemon in the and got a lime) delivered shortly after.     We started with the nachos.  Delicious flavors however could have been hotter and the home made tortilla chips were stale.  They clearly were made very early and reheated.   Now I was intreated in the double stack burger with bistro sauce, lettuce, tomato, onion with and onion ring on top.  Asked a few questions 1.  What type of beef was it,   Only response was that it was ground beef.  No info on grass fed, organic, fat content nothing.  2. What was the bistro sauce, response was is like a thousand island,no information added that made it their own.  I may be reaching to far but if a customer of mine was asking about a 22 dollar burger I would make it sound like there was no other burger like it on the planet.   Against my better judgement,  I ordered it. This is a 14 dollar burger at MOST!!!   Lacks flavor, and originality.   The only good flavor was the Gouda!!   All in all 1 appetizer, 2 burgers, 2 drinks and one side of onion rings that don't even come with the burgers totaled 64$.  Between to food,   Bad service and the extremely loud and theatric bartender slamming bottles around behind the bar I would suggest you cut your bill by 75%, skip this "burger joint" and go to a taco stand.   At least when you buy tacos you know what your getting!!

My friend and I made our way from S Michigan Ave to the Navy Pier. Decided we wanted to head over towards the Ohio St/Michigan Ave area to look for dinner and drinks. I had a craving for burgers. This place didn't catch my eye on a map, but we stumbled upon it and decided to give it a try. It was such a perfect decision! I had a Bistro Burger and it was exactly what I was looking for. My friend had the nachos and they were also delicious. We had their truffle frites, and again, perfect! The prices were reasonable as well. It was a quaint little restaurant but we didn't have to wait too long. Great service, great staff, great food. I will definitely be coming back to this place on my next visit.

We're from out of town and had a hankerin for a good burger. This place definitely hit the spot. The burger was very VERY flavorful, juicy and cooked to my liking. I got the American (fried mac and cheese, bacon, American cheese). Holy %#*. I inhaled it, then ate all my fries then picked off his plate. That's not to suggest the burger is small because it's not; it was just so good I wanted more. It was worth $12.

Went with a large party (for work) and the service was fantastic. Our waiter did an excellent job managing everyone's food and drink orders and working thru the various substitutions folks had with their meal. The food was great - bison burger is a definite must have. Opted for the veggies in lieu of fries - very good mix and cooked perfect. Would definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago.
Cool spot decent beer list.  American burger was awesome, Nachos were really good had good kick but well balanced.  Would defintely come back.
Thought I'd give it another try... Good and friendly service. Great but spendy signature drinks. 1 star burger - I ordered it medium and it came out crunchy.
Bbq burger and bacon burger with mac and cheese were both amazing!!! Would definitely recommend this place for burgers and beers :)

Can't front, Chef's Burger Bistro was my second option after I went to Volare and they had a stupid wait.  I went with the Bistro Burger since that is their name sake. Pretty standard thoroughfare. I am kinda basic with my burgers sometime so I added a fried egg. Decent, but not amazing. The best part of dinner was definitely the dessert. The chocolate peanut butter cake sounded it amazing, but was just ok. The real winner was the skillet cookie. Could easily have had about 73 of them.  I have read a lot about the happy hour here though, so maybe I should come back and check it out.

Stumbled upon this restaurant, it was really good. The burgers were a good size and came with house cut fries. The burgers were very juicy and contained fresh ingredients, very flavorful!! I had the Bbq burger and my husband had the American. Everyone was Super Friendly and very Helpful with offering sights to see around the city. Our waiter Johnny was amazing!!

Came here with a Groupon a couple weeks ago. And I have to say that I will easily come back without one. My boyfriend has been in the restaurant industry for 10+ years and we consider ourselves "foodies".. this was my treat. He said the burger he had (Bbq) was one of the best! I had the American burger.. and the mac n cheese that was hovered over the patty was delish and our beers were tasty! Happy hour seems legit. $2 for sliders that come with fries. And half off bottle of wine, plus other specials.  The staff were friendly. And, as we left many said goodbye. It was a friendly atmosphere. We went on a Monday around 6, didn't hear the loud music people previously were complaining about. Not sure about these negative reviews I had read. I work in the service industry- and I come to believe people just want to pick at something... anything! P.s. if you have an issue- talk to the management, instead of writing a 2 star review on Yelp... if you continue having issues then sure.

Been here 3 times already and returning tonight for our 4th visit. LOVE THIS PLACE! Owner Marco provides excellent customer service/value. My wife has rods in her back and he accommodated all our needs while providing a nice corner booth. Standup guy! Simply awesome burgers and sides and great happy hour. Keep offering awesome customer service and great value and we'll keep coming back. See you tonight for our 4:30pm (booth) reservation Marco!

First time here, what a great Happy Hour, flat bread pizza half off , oysters are a dollar each during happy hour, we also had a chicken pesto sandwich. This place is happening and hopping. Loved it!!!The owner Marco is soo sweet , and kept checking on us. The service was great.I can't wait to come back. Thanks Marco!! For a wonderful experience. See you soon.

Truffle fries! They were seasoned just right and we couldn't stop eating them.  Service was very attentive and gave great recommendations. The burgers were also cooked perfectly to order. We definitely over-indulged with the help of Groupon and it's worth a trip back.

Stopped in on the quest for a damn good burger. This satisfied in every way. Tom, who is a blast, recommended the American Burger. Fresh ground beef,  moist and flavorful with a dollop of fried mac n cheese, bacon and a cheese sauce along with fresh cut bistro fries. Yum! Seriously - you gotta place this location on your list. Great outdoor space too.

A group of us went there for a colleagues birthday. The service was bad. The food was okay. I arrived and said we were a group of seven. The hostess asked if we wanted a private room. I agreed and was seated. Water came. The waiter came and asked if I wanted a beverage. The rest of the group arrived a few minutes later, and the waiter never came back, so I had to go fetch him to remind him we were still there. He handed out menus and didn't take the drink order (which actually never happened - we all just drank water - other than one person who must have asked for it). Then more waiting. The waiter took our orders, and again we waited a looong time for the food to arrive.  The food was average. In a city full of gourmet burger places, the food isn't worth trying again. From around the table, the beet salad was dry, they wouldn't swap coleslaw for fries (they are the exact same price on the menu?!?!), and I ordered American cheese and it came with swiss.  Ironically, after we got the food, the manager and the waiter asked us multiple times how we were enjoying everything, and seemed really pleased with themselves. Then the staff wanted to clear our plates immediately, but there were plenty of other seats in that room. I don't think this place will be around long in a competitive burger market. It wasn't terrible, but there are so many other great options. I can't imagine anyone going back after trying it once.
Great ambiance, friendly staff. The PBJ Burger was very tasty and the truffle fries were delicious!

I ordered a burger - there were several options for more creative burgers, a bison burger, and vegan options. My burger was one of the best I have had in Chicago - sorry Chi town, Minneapolis destroys you when it comes to burgers still. I would have said this was 4 stars, but I ordered the onion rings. They were so bland I only ate two and let the waiter take the rest. The wait staff hardly seemed to notice I was disappointed. In fact I do not think they would have cared. In sum, the burgers are good, the sides are bland, and it is generally expensive for what you get. Maybe it is better for happy hour.

Such a good happy hour. Especially the 50c wings and $2 sliders. The sliders come with a side included!! How good is that deal?? I've read some of the negative reviews here and while I admit the service can be a little hit/miss and this place can be quite the tourist trap (I mean, come on, it's halfway between michigan avenue and navy pier), it's pretty stinkn good. The American Burger is a personal favorite, with a chunk of mac and cheese, bacon and of course burger meat! The beers are nothing to jump up about but if you stick with the happy hour, they do come at a pretty decent value for the area.

I'm all about the happy hour here... Too good of a value and top that off with $10 credits they frequently have available via the Spring Rewards app that you can claim and I typically walk out the door with a $10 bill or less. On my last happy hour adventure, we opted to share 10 wings at $0.50 a pop, 2 sliders at $2 a pop, and a bbq chicken flatbread half priced at $6. That was more than enough food for two and in addition we grabbed two beers each at $4. Bill Total = $34. Bill split between two of us each having $10 credit and we each paid $7. What a deal! Just to recap in case you didn't catch all that, I had 5 wings, 1 slider, half a flatbread, and two pints of beer for $7... The gluttony is too real.  Save money! Come during happy hour! 'Til next time, cheers cheers cheers!

My wife purchased the $35 Groupon, and we came away very impressed at the value. We split the BBQ Flatbread to start, which was pretty tasty. We also had the truffle fries with the fried egg on top, and they were solid, though the fried egg was a bit overcooked. Each of us really liked our burgers. The beer list, though limited, had some really good craft beer options, and my wife enjoyed her wine. Our service was excellent - they were well-staffed and our wait times were minimal (we came in after work around 5:30 pm on a Friday). We will be back.

Turkey burger one of my favorites from the menu.  A solid patty, seasoned and cooked well, topped with a thick-cut piece of bacon, and fresh lettuce/tomato.  The garlic aioli isn't a strong flavor, overcome by the bacon and turkey, so you can order without or get ketchup with it if that's your thing.  The side salad is presented nicely, and is light on the dressing (a good thing).  It's already mixed up so the dressing has evenly coated all parts, just a beautiful salad.  Service is on point, especially if you sit at the bar.  The Apex Predator sounded like a boss beer, and lived up to its name with a golden body with a hint of fruit.  Was $7 though, which is high for a beer, even on River North/Streeterville area.

Great offer for happy hour was $1 oysters. Fresh, sweet, east and west coast. Average service. Server arrived and stated " are you ready?" Happy hour crowd with only one table occupied. No advice offered when inquired about wine list. Above average for oyster quality only.

Hidden gem for happy hour; Chef's Burger Bistro has the best happy hour in River North/Loop area. $1 oysters, 50 cent buffalo wings, $2 sliders and half off flat breads. They also have decent $4/5 draft beer specials. Protip: you can pick most of their beef burgers as your $2 slider choice (the "american" has a hunk of mac & cheese & bacon as toppings and the "BBQ" has decent brisket as a topping). The wings aren't very flavorful (and a bit too greasy) but you can never go wrong with $1 oysters and $2 sliders. The oysters come with the standard lemon slices & cocktail sauce plus these pickled cucumbers that add a perfect salty crunch. 5 stars for happy hour! They also have $10 bottomless mimosas on Saturday/Sunday, which is *always* a good idea for brunch.

My husband and I went there with a groupon certificate. As we were eating our food a man came in from outside and headed directly to our table. Nobody was there to stop him and he asked for donations for whatever "charity" and when we told him we weren't interested he left with the waiter asking him to leave. The Manager was somewhere else. Well, he stole our two IPhones that were on the table and we didn't realize it until he was long gone. The manager gave us his card and told us to call him, which I have twice. He has not returned my calls and obviously does not want to take any responsibility for the theft. It was not a coat I checked, he allowed someone in his restaurant whose job it to steal. So, if you go there beware!!! Very aggravating to say the least. I don't recommend this restaurant because of management.

Been here a few of times and I must say, I like the atmosphere. Happy hour prices are good for the budget and the food and service is decent. Enjoyed the sliders; like you can mix and match. And the wings were fresh with good crunch. The patio in the summer is a good touch. Watched a couple of Cubs games while enjoying the freah air. I'll continue to make it a stop for the prices and service.

We decided to give them another chance when we saw Groupon was offering dinner plus wine for $35.  We went today during the second half of the Bears game.  Our server was very good and any disappointments I might have with the kitchen, is of course, not his fault. The wait was excruciating long for our bbq chicken flatbread and when it did show up, it looked very sloppy. It appeared thrown together & the crust undercooked. I would not recommend it. We also ordered two of the house "bistro burgers" and both were very good. Finally something to enjoy. The beef was a good portion & the house made bun was soft and held the weight of the beef, much better than when they first opened.  The side order of onion rings were over cooked & quite possibly re-fried before coming out.  I did notice the bartender seemed to be a lot of fun & made the round amongst the regulars. He brought a festive atmosphere to the place.  I would say Chef's Burger Bistro is a solid burger joint.

Oh my dear Mr. Chef, how conflicted, how lost I am about how to rate you. Twice I have went, twice! And sampled your turkish bourgeois (sp? turkey burger?) cuisine. For $13 I was provided this burger, cooked too much and without a side. The next venture, for the same price, I was provided a remarkably remade improvement and a side of fries. This leaves me perplexed, for either the consumable is sans side and overpriced or my order was provided to me with error the first time. Either way, points lost, points lost.  Such parting points, perhaps to be renewed upon a new purchase.

We came here for lunch on a Wednesday,  1pm to avoid the rush. The service was impeccable. Everyone was very nice and helpful and our server made great suggestions. My favorite part was the truffle fries served with an over easy egg. Yum. The burger was decent and everyone else enjoyed their meals.  I would like to come back for a happy hour and grab a drink, great ambiance.

Came here with a friend to use a Groupon, and we were well satisfied, but not blown away. The Groupon gave us the opportunity to have a drink each, share an app, a burger each, and share a side. That's a lot of food, and it was a very good deal. The beer list is decent, though not all of the beers are described on the menu, which for craft beers, I think is a necessity. At least tell me what kind of ale it is, or if it even is an ale. For our appetizer, we chose one of the flatbreads, which was probably a mistake given we were getting burgers afterwards. We went for the Liguria flatbread and were surprised to find out that those skinny shavings on it were lemon peels, and not cheese. Still, not a bad combination of flavors  with the chicken, roasted red pepper, and pesto.  For our side, my friend chose the truffle fries. I don't like the truffle flavor, but I didn't say anything because I didn't really want to fill up on fries anyway. They come on a large plate, with an egg on top (which is not mentioned in the menu description), and you can find some non truffled fries among them, so I had a couple, and they were tasty. We both opted for build your own burgers, because their gourmet offerings all had both appealing and not so appealing toppings mixed together and it didn't seem right to pick them apart, when we could just make our own. I ordered a medium rare burger with brie and an egg. Loved the brie. The burger was perfectly cooked. The egg was a bit overdone. And yet the burger was still messy and impossible to eat as a whole. My friend ordered the special sauce on the side and she could pick hers up. Good to know. By the way, the special sauce is basically thousand island dressing. All in all, it overfed me and I enjoyed it, though it certainly didn't inspire any I have to come back here again cravings.  The atmosphere itself was alright. The patio was still open and had a few groups out in it. But the restaurant was basically empty. Service was attentive, but then a regular walked in and created a lot of noise right next to us with the bartender, which was distracting and unpleasant. I'm all for old friends reuniting, but not when they're shouting at each other in a small space. With so many other excellent burger options around, I'm not sure I'd come running back.

We love the new Happy Hour. The sliders are amazing and so are the wings. We always order a side of onion rings as well. Definitely our neighborhood go to place for great food, music and service. Tom the bartender is by far the best in the city. Try it you'll love it.

This place was great! Tried it out for the first time last night. The only downside was a small menu, but plenty of really unique burger options to pick from. Some items were on the pricier side, but this place offers some awesome deals! On M-F 3-7pm, beef sliders are $2 each. I tried the American (fried mac & cheese & bacon!), a porkbelly/pb&j with brie cheese slider & a BBQ brisket with cheddar slider. All were amazing. I also got an Anti-Hero IPA ($4!!). Great quality for such a low price!

Upstairs closed due to private function, so seated in the bar on game one of Cardinals vs Cubbies playoff game. Crowed and service a little slow but sever was courteous and helpful with our ordering. All had different burgers and were well satisfied. Wish they toasted their delicious buns. Tried two kinds of fries and the onion rings, liked the fries loved the rings. A good meal.
Ordered the PBJB burger...great concept except the pork belly wasn't soft lots of hard pieces. It was a tasty burger though. The onion rings were extremely delicious!!

We were in town for a conference and stumbled upon this place. They have a nice patio with very friendly staff. I can't remember our servers name but he was so friendly and seemed to actually care about us, in making small convo with our party of 8. All of our food looked delicious! I had the chicken sandwich and it was amazing! Pretty large portion sizes for lunch also. This was a great find for our lunch break! Highly recommend!

I have no idea why this place has 3 stars.  I came in on a Friday night and was seated immediately, yet it was fairly busy. We started with the wings, which were great.  Then I ordered a chefs burger with avocado jalapeños and bacon with the special sauce. The meat was amazing, and all of the ingredients tasted very fresh. I've had burgers everywhere in the city, from kumas to au cheval, and this burger definitely ranks up there. Also the fries were great! 5/5 easy, everything was perfect
Absolutely enjoyed lunch.  Lamb burger, bistro fries and Bistro Salad were great.  The side of seasonal veggies were freakin spectacular! Five stars from The Ross Grouo.  getrossnow.com
Terrible service. Or maybe bartender was having a terrible day. Dk..either way won't be back

Not sure how they only have 3 stars. The burgers alone are delicious if you like to keep it simple. If you like a unique twist to your already fantastic burger they have a variety of choices on the menu from a burger with Fried Mac n Cheese to Pork Belly with PB&J. Top the fantastic food with friendly and efficient service and you've got yourself a great value. Cheers to the Chef for keeping it fresh!

This is one of the best little neighborhood bars. The outdoor area is the perfect chill spot and the staff is extremely friendly. Not to mention Tommy--the best most sassy fabulous bartender east of Michigan Avenue!

This place was near our hotel and we liked the look of the outdoor patio so we made reservations for 7 people for 6 pm.    We knew we were running late so we called at 5 pm and asked if we could push back to 6:30 pm.  No problem.   We arrive at 6:30 pm sharp.  "Sorry, we gave your table away.  Our policy is to hold them for 15 mins."   No record of our call.   Hmmmm...odd.  Ok, we decide to wait.  We finally get a table on the very nice patio.   Nice server but really SLOW service.  Appetizer came out with the burgers.  Asked for ketchup for one of the burgers (the rest of us got our little stainless steel cup of ketchup but one of us didn't) and it was 10 minutes before it arrived.   It seemed like 15 minutes because we were halfway through our burgers when it finally arrived.  Had we known, we would have shared our ketchup.   The burgers were pretty good but not amazing.  As someone else pointed out, there are 4 burgers:  a classic, a beef brisket, a lamb and a turkey.  The burgers don't come with any sides.  The homemade coleslaw was lame.  No flavor at all.   The fries were good but small portions.  Everyone else had drinks (wine, sangria, etc.) and I had a coke.  Not one check in to see if I wanted more.  When my glass was empty, it was pulled off the table and that was that.  I drank my water.  They have great bussers who make sure you have plenty of water.   I enjoyed the patio and my burger was ok but I wouldn't come back again.

This place major sucks, my husband and I came to eat here hoping to have amazing burgers but we were disappointed. Let me start with the service, our waitress never smiled at us wasn't helpful at all, but when we saw she was serving a all white family's table she was giggling smiling and stuff. We never got a refill on our drinks, the burgers are small for the price they ask for, ooohh the fries come separate. When we finally got our burgers 35 minutes after we order, they were a huge disappointment, mushy on the inside it was just gross . Ugh such a horrible experience in this place. Never coming back here.

I would like to believe that I'm some kind of burger connoisseur, but I'm probably not... regardless this place makes a pretty nice burger.  I ordered the Bistro Burger as is, no special instructions other than being cooked to medium.  The meat was perfectly seasoned.  The onions were also perfect.  Usually they put too many on or they are too crisp and fall off after the ring is broken but these were done right (cooked down slightly I believe).  Also the romaine lettuce, fresh pickles, and brioche bun were a nice touch.  I ordered a side of fries which were also good, but nothing about them really stood out.  Next time I'll opt for the onion rings which someone else at my table ordered.  They were delicious. I'll definitely add this to my recommended list of restaurants for burgers in Chicago.  My only caveat is that it will cost you like $12/burger, $4/fries which seems a bit high, but then again this is downtown Chicago, so it's really not that bad.

I was very disappointed....took my boyfriend out to lunch for his birthday and it was an awful experience.  We looked up the menu on line and was excited to see all the different burger options. When we were given the menu only 4 burgers were in the menu!!!  BUT they only had 3 options for the day, they didn't have any lamb burgers.  When I asked about the burgers that were listed online our server said they hadn't had any of those burgers in months. I also ordered two different glasses of wine that were not available.  We ordered the turkey burger with the lamb set up and basic bistro burger medium rare, of course it comes out well done, we also ordered the truffle fries to share. The burgers comes back and it's perfect, but still no fries. Fries finally come out annnnnnnnd they are cold with no taste of truffle. The food took almost 25 minutes, fries 35 minutes!!! You could tell our sever was embarrassed by the food that came out, she stayed away from our table until we asked the busser to bring us a box.  Not once did a manager come over to ask how our lunch was or if the second burger was made correctly, he didn't apologize for the fries taking 35 minutes to come out.  I was excited to try a new place close to where I work.....should have went to Kuma's

A buddy of mine lives not too far from this joint and he thought it would be a good idea to come here for lunch. I've never tried it but any place with burger in the title is an easy sell for me. It was pretty nice out so we sat on the patio to enjoy. Our server Aoife who was pretty quiet came over and took our order. I got the bistro burger which came with lettuce, tomato, and pickles along with something called bistro sauce...I never figured out what that was but that burger was good as fuck! I was able to choose a cheese and I went with the creamy brie which definitely set that mf off! Definitely a burger to be reckoned with as it was a nice size and quite juicy...I like it that way!

I knew something was off the moment we walked in, and were seated at a table that was both wobbly and had a booth where no one was actually facing each other. I got the Lamb Burger, and it was very tangy and not very tasty. I ate half the burger before I gave up, it was just not good at all. Pretty good truffle frites though.

My friends and I were in the city for the day to visit Navy Pier and needed a place to eat. We found this place while we walked away from the pier and decided we were feeling burgers. First off, the table we sat at was a small booth that had us all awkwardly facing the same direction. If you like that, then this is the place for you!  Service was good and the waitress was very nice.  Onto the food... We ordered lamb burgers, the bistro burger, onion rings, and truffle frites. All the burgers looked good to begin with, but the taste was a whole new story. All our burgers tasted mushy on the inside and was extremely off putting. I'd equate the texture to wet dog food. The onion rings were fairly decent, until I ate another ring that was doused in salt. Poorly seasoned, but ok. The saving grace was the truffle frites. They were delicious and had a huge portion.  Overall if you want a poor burger and severely overpriced menu items, then I totally recommend this place. Otherwise, pick any other place.

not sure why the service was so bad. but wow. So terrible. The food was alright after they finally got my girlfriends burger correct. And the bartender was the best part. But dude, the service. The manager ended up being our  waiter and his attitude was appaling. then tried to save his behind at the end by offering free dessert. nice touch but overall I was still very dissapointed.

We 4 girls stopped in for lunch. We ordered the bistro burger, lamb and vegetarian burger.  All 3 burgers were great.  Our sides were onion rings and truffle frites. Our server was very informative and charismatic

Decent burgers with nice flavor, but nothing amazing there. The truffle fries were nice albeit a bit more pricey, and made a nice sharing portion for 3. The wings were good, but again nothing out of this world. Service was alright, fairly friendly and responsive. Outdoor seating was pleasant.  The prices originally attracted us, with so many restaurants with ridiculously expensive prices around, but not the best value.  Food was alright, portions were okay, no big complaints though. The fries did come a bit cold, and the vegetables on the burgers seemed sort of just thrown on like fast food. Also be careful, the yelp free dessert offer is valid from 4-6 so don't get your hopes up if you're there at the usual lunch/dinner times (I also didn't see the dessert menu so not too sure what we missed).

This place used to be a great place to get a burger or a salad, but it seems they have changed their menu.  The salmon salad that I ordered for carryout didn't even contain all of the ingredients listed.  The entire salad was also very small.  The salmon was shredded and did not taste right.  You used to get a whole piece of fresh fish!  Rarely am I unable to finish a salad, but I ended up throwing it away and that is $15 down the drain.

I really enjoy coming here for a plate of indulgence. I love hamburgers and they definitely know how to take the average and make it fantastic. Flavors you would not think of putting together (lamb burger) are combine to create a memorable dining pleasure. Each burger is unique and no one flavor over powers the burger. You enjoy the meat, along with seasoning, and the toppings. So many places over do one flavor which is all you taste. Not here. Great balance.  The duck fat fries are outstanding. Wings are great and service excellent. They make their own buns which illustrates the attention given to every part of the burger. For the price the value is superb.

BEST BURGER IN TOWN the service is great and the burgers are phenomenal. I recommend getting the wings as an appetizer, and the bistro burger, in my opinion the bistro burger is the best burger in Chicago. Love it! Overall great restraunt!
Good gourmet burgers.  For a change I had the lamb burger they got to offer. The sauce offered with the burger was pretty amazing.

We waited a few minutes to be seated on a Saturday evening on their nice outdoor patio. They have a huge space, two large floors of a building. I ordered a veggie burger, which featured a savory I think bean-based patty--nothing to write home about, but decently satisfying. I liked their bun bread, which is soft and rich. The boy got the turkey burger, which looked like a pretty sizable patty and thus a good deal, as all their burgers are ~$10-15. All the servers were pretty chatty, which was amusing.

I went here with my family while we were in Chicago for the first time! We were seated immediately and our server was so warm and outgoing! We had the bistro burger and veggie burger, both were great! Would come here again

Was tooling around the area with a group and decided to give this place a try.  Seated us pretty quick and thankfully turned the music in our side room down to a mild roar.  So 4 stars four our waitress.   Burgers were good but of the handful of burger choices the lamb and another burger were sold out.  Shame because the lamb burger sounded good.   Had the burger with an egg and manchego? cheese.  Asked for medium.  Got medium well. At least the meat seemed quality.   Price was high but the cost of the fries was silly.  Think McDonald small for 3 bucks. Good fries but with the cost of the burger seemed weird.   Beers range from 5 bucks all the way up to "your joking right?" Best part of the night was when a well dress maybe Russian hostess helped deliver the food to the wrong place setting only to accuse us of swapping seats.  Might have been offended if it wasn't so hilarious.   Might be back to try a lamb burger but would rather keep looking for a burger bar.

Service was not impressive to start with, it's obvious they were understaffed.  Our appetizer, chicken wings was undercooked; practically half raw. We informed the server and at least her attitude was much nicer after that.  She took it back and mentioned it'll be on her. The entrée was decent, ordered bistro burger.  When they brought the chicken wings, it was undercooked AGAIN! I'm completely speechless and definitely never been served undercooked food twice (same dish?!).  The server apologized, do understand it's not her fault. It's the kitchen. But definitely would NOT recommend this place. Don't waste your money at this place. The sangria tasted like sugar water, undercooked appetizer (twice!!!), ok burger... Grateful the server was apologetic though. But again, don't waste your money and time at this place!

I read the reviews about this restaurant before going and was disappointed to see the negative review about the vegetarian burger, overall the reviews were good.  I decided to go and even ordered the vegetarian burger. I'm glad I did because it was delicious!  I spoke with my server and was informed they just changed their menu and that includes many new choices. I witnessed the chef bringing out their new menu items and asking customers to try the new items.  Great experience!

extremely embarrassed!! I brought my office of 15 people to dine today from Northwestern Memorial Hosp.  Six  of the lunch entrees were not correct as ordered or not cooked properly.  Had to send back an entree and still did not come back correct for the reason it was returned.  As a group we will not be returning.  We waited 45 mins. for our meals to be prepared and brought to the table.   The wait and inaccuracy was unacceptable.  Waitress was very nice.  Just found out 2 more orders were incorrect.  so a total of 8 meals were not prepared properly or as requested.  Very disappointing.
Lamb burgers are delicious here. It's light and definitely will hit the spot. I didn't walk out stuffed and unable to move. A+

Had the Paris burger with sweet potato fries. Asked to have my burger cooked medium..came cooked well. Dry and tasteless meat. Fries were a lil soggy. Friend had to send her order back which resulted in making my food colder waiting for hers to be prepared as asked. Won't be back,

Came here for a private event and was highly disappointed. We were served a salad that consisted of lettuce. Lettuce. No tomatoes. No cucumbers. Not even a carrot. The next course was pasta. Semi warm pasta that tasted like it was made with jarred sauce. My friend, who is gluten free, was served a bowl of bland risotto that left an awful after taste. Approximately 3 hours later, and we are waiting for the main course. My hopes are not high. My jack and ginger and the chocolate cake shots have been the highlight of my evening. Edit: got our main course. Our table of 12 received 10 thinly sliced, cold pieces of beef, some mashed potatoes, and soggy asparagus.

Asked for medium  rare got well done. I froze while they kept the door open moving furniture  in front of my booth. Service was mediocre. I had to move myself to another table to avoid the chill until an employee noticed and assisted. By the way I was one of few customers so they should have figured it out sooner. My meal was nothing to write home about.
Really good place in downtown Chicago...Excellent burger. .perfect medium. ..  nice beer...great service. ...

YUCK, YUCK, YUCK, YUCK, YUCK!!! I give this place a 5-Yuck rating. First, if you order delivery, plan on your order being wrong and the restaurant not caring at all that they just threw something at you that you did not order and would not eat (but your incorrect order will be delivered super speedy! Yay)... Have you ever seen those FB posts "You had one job... Epic fails," that is Chef's Burger Bistro. If you have a food allergy BEWARE, they do not adhere to a standard that would involve not killing you via anaphylaxis. Second, the fried pickles are not pickles, they are cucumbers (no vinegar, literally, cucumber) in a deep fried coating with zero seasoning. The ranch is a mayo-tartar combo that promptly made me vomit after two bites. The burger bun is the consistency of that "yoga-mat" bread and has a rubbery texture and appearance. The "Bistro Secret Sauce" is mayo, thousand island, and pickle bits and smells like egg salad that's been left out on a hot summer day. The meat was falling apart because whatever mystery grade beef they use has a dry, particle consistency and can not hold form like a cooked beef patty should. So the summary of this review is: If you enjoy excessive, warm, spoiled mayonnaise, not getting what you ordered, and paying to be poisoned at a super fast delivery speed- This is the place for you! If you actually value customer service, good food, and getting what you paid for- do not ever order from or eat at this place. Thanks Chef's Burger Bistro for giving me inedible food and involuntary bulimia! EPIC FAIL #EpicFail

I would say that Burger Bistro is just fine...and it commits the crimes that most Loop/River North/Streeterville burger places commit as well. Stopped by for a lunch reservation yesterday.  Fairly quiet for a 60-degree Monday.  We had a half-moon-shaped booth and I ordered the Bistro Burger Your Way medium rare with cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes and onions.  My wife and I split the onion rings (fine) and the salted caramel shake (tasty, not mind-blowing). The burger itself was cooked closer to medium/medium-well...but the Crimes Against Humanity here are the prices for the burger and then the fact that those prices don't include fries.  So, as is, you are looking at about $16-$17 for a burger with fries here.  Sorry, not even close! I might come back with friends who work close to this location, but Chicago has a ton of great burger places that are cheaper!

Excellent service and staff was extremely congenial...comped dessert was a nice touch as well.  Burgers, pizza, and specialty fries will do wonders for a hungry soul.  Einbecker NA beer was new for me (a bit hoppy).

First off I don't even know if we had a waiter/waitress. We sat down and then 30 minutes later we decided to get menus ourself. Then got attention of a "worker" got beer menu came back ordered drinks (overpriced) and food with an appetizer. Hour later we get our food never receiving our appetizer. They asked if we still want it (Are you serious?!?!). Decent food but not worth the wait and overpriced beer. No sorry. If you want to go to city to eat. Don't waste your time here.

We found this restaurant hidden about 2 minutes from our hotel, it was the first place we ate at once we got to Chicago! The sweet potato fries were beyond AMAZING, they were so good and very crispy and crunchy but with all the taste. The burger was also amazing, I created my own because the other ones didn't seem to catch my attention but the burger was amazing as well. The onion rings were also delicious and very cripsy! Overall, I recommend you eat here if you can!

I saw this driving by in a cab so I gave it a try. It was a Monday night so it was busier with delivery pick ups than actual patrons. I sat at the bar and was served by the animated friendly bartender. The burger and entire menu was very interesting. I ordered the Chicago Tribune burger which was very good. I also tried the duck fat fries (healthy I know) which were also nice. The cocktail menu was good but the selection of craft beers was really good. I tried a few. Some yelpers have commented that it is expensive. However, a trendy burger/beer/cocktail place in any city is the same price. Overall, I enjoyed it.

I ate here yesterday for the first time and it was amazing! I got a BBQ burger and a Salted Carmel Shake. Both were just so good and I was very satisfied, the overall scenery is nice too, very good looking restaurant/bar.

Perfect for what we were looking for. A semi-casual environment with a decent vibe and great food. The Paris Burger was amazing and the bistro chicago beef sandwich was to die for. I love this place for easy, good food at a reasonable price.

Went to Burger Bistro on Valentine's Day on a whim and they had seats available which was awesome!  Luckily they had their usual menu plus a V-day menu, so we were able to get to try their specials.  They definitely know how to make good burgers.  Even the regular fries were on point.  For dessert we had the raspberry sauce + flour less cocoa cake + vanilla ice cream.  OMG!  So good.  Service was great too!

So this place looks a little weird when you walk by and when you go in its kind of a strange vibe to be honest. However, there burger and duck fat fries are among the best I've ever had. The duck fat fries are really amazing. Probably the best fries I've ever had. So get past the strange vibe and feel of the place and try it.

Get the duck fat fries! Do it! The service is always friendly and these burgers are stupendous. The only thing my date regretted was that they didn't have a stout on tap but I don't care about that so 5 STARS!

The server was nice. The food not so nice. Fries were way too salty u need to drink a glass of water after every fry. French onion soup tasted like dirty dish water, and the season veggies tasted burnt. Even my friends burger was bad. Said Wendy's was better

Everything was good Luke warm temps sent back food to warm it what bothered me was their online menu with specials offers to be updated all not available and checked in with yelp and was told none of the offers were available so really need to update online special and offers!!
Good bistro atmosphere Nothing too special about the decoration  Paris burger is amazing Duck fries not so much  Other burgers are okay.

Service was --- weird. I think our waiter was trying to be helpful but instead he was not helpful. For instance- we asked him for the check and he split it. We had shared everything too so it didn't make sense. And he was full of humor- but just too much humor. I guess he was just excited to have people to serve! I got a hottie tottie and it was perfect. Made with honey, tea, whiskey, and whatever else does the magic! Service is also slow! Happy hours are totally worth if you work around the area with wing specials (that are so meaty and wet) and sliders for just a dollar.  You get a free dessert for checking in and he accepted it on the weekend when it was weekdays only. This is perfect for after a movie right by AMC. It's also okay if you have kids!
Classy burger joint and bar. Great selection.  Great service.  Seems like a favorite hang out with regulars. We'll be back.

Really tasty burgers. Modern vibe. Cool people. Liked it a lot. Go for the Paris Burger, it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. -2 for kind of lackluster taps. +1 for great selection of bottled beer.

Horrible! For a place that has "burger" in its' name, this soul-less yupster joint was a HUGE disappointment. My "Bistro Burger" arrived lukewarm, overcooked and pretty much tasting like it was pumped out of a burger-making machine. In fact, my dinner probably would have been more enjoyable if I had walked a few blocks further and dined at McDonalds. (for about one tenth the price!) And don't get me started on the overpriced drinks. Don't waste an opportunity to enjoy one of the many fine restaurants in Chicago by stopping in at this place. You've been warned.

Ordered the B50 burger half betef half bacon, seemed a bit undercook for a medium well and the paris not well done unfortunantly . Food was good not the best but just good. Ambient was nice, customers service was great.
You have to get off of the Ave in order to get a decent meal. Well, at least, a comfortable and casual meal! Burger Bistro is comfortable, has a nice beer and wine list, and it's a good score!
Had the wings, pastrami tacos, and sliders. Everything was amazing and everyone was very friendly. Definitely recommend if you're in the area!

My family went here on New Years Day because "The Purple Pig" was a long wait.  We ended up ordering the Paris Burger (not bad), the Duck Fat Fries (Yummy and crunchy), the Bistro Chicago Beef (very flavorful-Roast beef sandwich on a toasted bun with tasty red pepper and onions), and finally the Heirloom Beets (Our Favorite- Beets, goat cheese, candied Walnuts with a delicious tangy/sweet sauce.  The staff were very accommodating, especially seeing my son dropped his drink all over the floor. Our waitress was a bit slow...the decor was very cleac with hald moon tables in a booth.

Since I live in the Streeterville area-I had high hopes I would like this place. Unfortunately I didn't.  I ordered a medium well hamburger and the minute I took a bite-blood came pouring out which made me lose my appetite. If you want fries, it costs extra-seriously? My companions "Lamb" burger had a real gamey taste to it. Overall it was pretty terrible. I will not be returning.

Very awesome beer selection and delicious beers (I especially enjoyed trying the Delirium Tremens). The flatbread pizza appetizer is perfectly fine, but a bit on the bland side. The burgers themselves are priced modestly and tasty, but the paris burger wasn't that amazing, certainly not "award-winning" worthy in my opinion (despite the menu's self-important claims). The best thing about dining here is the service, which is really great.
The B50 burger is one of the best in Chicago, plus the coleslaw is very good. The duck fat fries are not worth the hype.  Decent beer selection, but not great.

The Chicago Tribune burger and the Paris burger were both creations that I liked a lot. The Duck fat fries have more body than regular fries and were a nice upgrade. The reason for three stars was the Mac and cheese which somehow an order of magnitude worse than Kraft boxed Mac and cheese -- the menu would be better off without it, especially given their strong burger offerings.

While it looks small from the outside, Chef's Burger Bistro has ample seating on the inside. I came on Saturday for a late lunch, and they seated us right away, and the restaurant was fairly busy. It took us about 30 minutes to get the burger (which is what the waiter told us) I got the Paris burger and the Duck Fat fries. The toppings and the sauce was yummy, and the patty was thick and filling. The disappointing part is the the meat wasn't flavored at all. All the taste of the burger came from the sauce that was slathered on top of it. In addition, while I ordered medium rare, it was definitely more medium/well done than rare.  The duck fat fries were okay. They are just flavored fries that are really oily. The regular fries were also kind of unflavored, so the duck fat fries were a good choice.  The food was pretty good. However, I don't think I'll be back. For the price I'm paying I expect the burger to be bigger and more flavored.

Great beer selection,  fantastic steak sandwich and a very nice and informative bartender named Michael. Good looking artisan menu based entirely on quality ingredients, and food came out quickly and correctly.

Nice environment and wait staff. The food was below par compared to the many other burger restaurants in Chicago. The burgers were not prepared at the temp we asked for. The duck fries were oily. The sweet potatoes fries and onion rings lacked seasoning. The cocktails were watery. The waitress even admitted day-old ginger ale was used in one. Their beer was good though. Not impressed. The food is not worth going back for. But I'd go back for a beer...maybe.

Excellent food and great service. I've been here a couple times with wife, it's a great date night type of joint. Paris Burger and Bistro Burger are my go-to's, but also enjoyed the B50. Their beer selection is pretty good as well, they seem to be expanding into more craft brews too. Overall, highly recommended, DEFINITELY worth a visit.
Had a delicious grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup for lunch.  Liked it a lot.  Got seated in the back room which I did not care for.
I had the Paris Burger with onion jam and brie...it was great. The restaurant has good atmosphere and the service was amazing.

This spot caught my eye since hamburgers were what the tummy called for. Such a cute smaller venue and very personal service which was great.  I ordered the camel burger, yes I stated camel. Exciting and exotic right? Well that's what caught my eye! I loved it! So juicy, flavorful and not to mention my mind was in wow that I was actually eating camel. The burger was great, too bad I couldn't say much about the fries which fell more than short after the burger. Had a milkshake to pair with the camel which was good also but I think after having such an amazing burger I expected the same amazingness from the rest of the order.  If in the mood for something different definitely the place to go.

Whatever burger you choose, make sure it has the Onion Jam on it.  Seriously - nice atmosphere and fantastic burgers, what more do you want from a place like this.  They have a lot of interesting gourmet burger selections to choose from. I went with a create your own. But definitely get the Onion Jam. It's delicious.

This review is mostly for the service, though the food was delicious.  I was in town for the Chicago Marathon weekend and after trying three super crowded restaurants, the hostess at the sister restaurant Volare recommended we come here. There wasn't any pasta on the menu, so my party and I waited in the lobby to search for somewhere else to eat so I could carbo load.  The manager/owner (not quite sure who he was but he was definitely in charge) let us stand in his lobby to stay out of the cold but mentioned that they did have a special marathon pasta menu.  We decided to stay, were seated immediately and every well taken care of. The food was great!  I had pasta off the marathon menu and it was delightful.  The others in my party had the hand-crated burgers, and even my aunt who is a very picky eater enjoyed her meal.  Not to mention how much everyone enjoyed their specialty drinks.  I'd definitely check this place out again next time I'm in town.

I keep coming back for more !!! And this time they added Game burgers to the menu most interesting:Kangaroo and Camel- crazy but I HAD to try it!! It was delicious tasted like nothing I've ever had before ! Also added new sandwiches and more milkshakes !! Every time I dine there is something new and Delicious on the menu! Highly recommend
Solid service at the bar. Solid menu based in local sources, local beers. Way underrated in yelp!
This is the best place in Chicago for a burger . It's also a great place to have a drink . Tom is easily one of if not the best bartenders in Chicago . I def reccomend stopping in.

Over priced & under delivered. Paris Burger was ok, good ingredients but but didn't come together. Grilled Cheese & Tomato soup was disappointing.   We live in the neighborhood and we're excited but ....

Gourmet crafted burgers at a reasonable price.  I was walking downtown Chicago and came across this burger place. I gave the menu a quick glance and was more than enough to give the place a shot.  Burgers are sophisticated, including premium ingredients like Spanish Ibérico ham, and are overall well crafted.  I order a Wagyu Burger with crispy onion, house sauce and a beet slice. I was overall very happy, I thought the beet gave it s very unique twist. Although the bun was a little dry and not at its best, that's why I give them 4 stars.  I would definitely visit this place sometime soon.

Great crew! Gets busy like any good spot will get on date nights. For the best experience go on a not-so-busy night. Some really good beers including one of their own. If you're not up for a burger or want something different their wings are outstanding. They just changed the recipe and it's really tasty. I live in the area and end up here 2-3 times a week. Burgers are tasty but read the menu and take suggestions. Just a bit cryptic but the staff can guide you quite nicely. Only recommendation I have is I wish they had more sit-down tables. When outdoor seating is not available there are maybe 8-10 tables and the rest are stools and high tables...not my favorite way to dine.

I am not only a huge fan of this place because I live next door, but there are so many more reasons why Burger Bistro is my new favorite hangout. It has become my new "Cheers" bar, where literally everyone knows my name. Everyone who works there is so nice and outgoing. The two main bartenders, Thomas and Michael, are fun and friendly...not to mention you definitely get your money's worth. The burgers and the shrimp tacos are delicious...try the sweet potato fries! I only wish they could incorporate some karaoke nights and a few more appetizers. Overall, I love this place!

My friend and I went here for lunch on a weekday. The waitress who was friendly and attentive was really trying to push alcohol on us even after we said no-thank you. I'm thinking it's to distract you from the food. I had the salad with salmon. The "greens" in the salad were mostly the hard white part of the lettuce. The piece of salmon was perhaps 2" x 3". The goat cheese was practically non-existent. C'mon, for $13 I should think they could put together a better salad than this. My friend had a do-it-yourself burger which she said was not seasoned. I tried some of her duck fat fries and they tasted like regular old fries, she thought so too.  I think this place caters to tourists who won't be repeat customers anyway. I really miss Blackies burgers formerly in this location since I am not planning to go back here to sample the burger.

Yowza!  This place is jumping!  And what I thought was going to be a casual  burger joint- turned out to be a happening place with a great patio, a full bar and some really good tasting food! Located where Blackies once stood, Chefs Burger Bistro offers up some pretty tasty burgers ( don't like beef?  Try kangaroo, camel or boar instead.  Yep!  I said kangaroo!!). Crazy, right? We went on a sunny Friday afternoon and this place was packed!  After about a 20 minute wait they found us a table for 4 and we were off and running! The decor is quite nice with big circular booths lining the bar area and high tops scattered about.  Hanging over the busy bar are these ruby red fixtures that are suggestive without being overt.  Upstairs- the rooms would be perfect for a party with huge windows open to the patio and skylights letting in the sunshine.  Big globe lights add a contemporary flair. We started with the shrimp ceviche- a little bland but still good.  But then on to the star of the show, the burgers!  And as good as the burgers were- know that they come served on these artisan rolls that are baked in house 3 times daily.  Delicious! I tasted the 50/50 (a burger made with 50% ground bacon and beef) which was the winner at our table for overall taste.  The boar burger was good but it came pretty rare for our table who liked things cooked a little more.  And the camel and kangaroo burger were both lean and tasty. As a side- we went with the duck fat fries and these were delicious! Service was spot on given how busy it was and management stopped by a couple of times to make sure we were all enjoying ourselves! Don't think that because it's a burger place that this is a cheap date.  Average check at our table was $25 a person and no one had a drink.  Guess those camels and kangaroos demand a high price! So if you are a burger lover- check out Chef's Burger Bistro!  Your taste buds will thank me!

This place is pretty good. It was recommended by the hotel doorman, aplace to watch MNF without a huge crowd. I sat at the bar, Tracey took good care of me. I started with chicken wings, very good. Just spicey enough. Steak burger was really good. Craft beer on draft was a little weak but okay. I'm glad the Bears game came on with sound. They need to lose the disco music.

I must admit my expectations were low, because everyone knows that really nothing good happens east of michigan AVE.  However, I have to say this was the best turkey burger i have ever had (probably out of 50 total at different restaurants).  I also had a fantastic server at the bar.    Really impressed and glad I ventured east, as risky as that often seems to be.   I will be back, and look forward to trying some of the specialty cocktails.  Solid draft beer list as well - and willing to let you try whatever you want with a real decent sample pour.

Fantastic addition to the neighborhood! From Tom the bartender to Marcelina and Marko the managers the service is fantastic and makes you feel at home.  The burgers are great and the fries and onion rings are excellent additions. Looking forward to continuing to invest my $ in my 'hood!

Im surprised this place didnt get higher reviews.  Food is good...especially the duck fries!! Had the paris burger and loved the unique ingredients :-) we had a waitress in training and she did a phenomenal job. Definitely a place id check out again!

Surprised at some of the negative comments here. Never heard of this place before and stopped in for a quick dinner before a movie.  Our meal was two new menu items as of three days ago. The Bistro Flatbread and the Chicago beef. And an old menu item, the duck fat fries.  I am very sensitive to comments about bad service so got a little concerned reading the reviews. Needless to say we had no issues. Our water was promptly refilled, our server educated us on the menu items we had questions on (buns and rolls are made from scratch) and our drinks were refilled as needed.  The fries were amazing. Ordered the Buttermilk Blue sauce for them and didn't need it at all but it was still delicious as well.  Food was great. Service was great. Prices I thought were very reasonable. One exception - $9 for an Anti-Hero seemed a little steep. On the other hand, the $7 I paid for my Dogfish Head 90 minute was more than fair. Overall I'd definitely come back. I'm anxious to try the wings and pastrami tacos!

I'd rate these as average burgers. I ordered the 1/3lb burger with chedder cooked to medium. My two friends also ordered their burgers medium. All three of our burgers were cooked medium well. We were all starving and didn't feel like sending them back so we ate them as is. I ordered the side of duck fat fries. For $4 the portion size seemed a bit tiny. They were ok though I couldn't really detect any duck fat flavoring.

Came here recently, and at first sight, it was a hopping restaurant, with lots of people eating and drinking.  Then we ordered food, and everything went down hill... See below. Ambience:  Vibrant, has outdoor patio, great for meeting with friends, modern decor Service: Kind, decent, and above average (especially since we had to send back food) Food:  Terrible.  For a burger place, the burgers were flavorless, dry and dense.  We ordered a camel burger, which I wasn't expecting to be amazing, but we also ordered the Bistro 50, which is basically their signature beef burger.  And this beef burger had no flavor!  We were literally dumping salt on our burgers!  We also ordered wings and the salmon salad to start.  The wings were just mediocre (went to Jake Melnick's the night before, and the wings there were A LOT better) and our salmon salad had crispy kale that was so crispy we couldn't even cut it with a knife, much less chew it!  My husband thought it was plastic in the salad when he first took a bite... turns out it was kale...

This place has a lot of negative reviews so I was glad I ate here before I looked on Yelp (yes, these things do happen sometimes!) I needed a break from using the Divvy bike (my first time doing that in Chicago), and this was the closest place the station I had docked my bike in. Service was great. I was in and out in 30 min. I ordered the Paris burger which has Onion jam, roasted tomatoes, brie cheese on top of the burger. I ordered garlic aioli on the side (for my sweet potato fries), and a side of jalapenos for the burger. The jalapenos were definitely different. They had a pickled type taste to them, but they complement the meal very well. (I actually ate way more than my stomach wanted me to!) The burgers aren't huge, but they're just the right size to make you full, but not disgustingly full...the order of fries will help push you over into the disgusting territory. ;)
Great food. Tried the camel burger and it was delicious. The bartender was horrible.  The worst bartender in the world. Went out of the way to ignore us.  I would never fo there again.

Went here for lunch with co-workers and the service was appalling. We ordered relatively quickly and the server seemed attentive, but our food never came. Half-hour went by, then 45 minutes. All the tables around us, even people who arrived well after us were being served.  Eventually, we caught the waiter's attention and he said "your food's coming right out." It never came. Another 20 minutes goes by. So we see the manager and ask him what the deal is. He just sort of has this blank stare on his face and says "let me check on it" and walks away, never to be seen again. No apology. Several minutes later, the waiter returns to fill up our water and reassures us the burgers are coming and promises to give us "dessert" on the house. Dessert? How about lunch first!? So finally, we gave up and  went to Doc B's down the street where service and the food were both fantastic. Are Burger Bistro's burgers all they're cracked up to be? We couldn't tell ya.

Should be so much better.  Our server, while very nice, was just not well informed. Unable to answer questions like what was on a particular hamburger and if the draft beers were light or dark.  Just kept referring us back to the menu.  But not clear on the menu either.  I asked what the "seasonal vegetable" was and she told us a mix of cauliflower and broccoli.  I ordered it and a couple of minutes she returned to say the chef told her that it was coleslaw.  Didn't know coleslaw counted as a seasonal veggie.  Anyway the fries were cold.  No excuse for that.  Should be made fresh.  Also our burgers were supposed to be with an egg on top.  The egg was hard cooked which cannot be right.  Should have been cooked enough so that yolk runs when cut.  What I think may have happened is that the burger was sitting for a while at the food counter and the egg "cooked" while waiting to be delivered to us.  At the gourmet prices Burger Bistro is charging, the service and food quality should be top notch.   Nice place though.  Won't be back since there a lot of other places vying for my gourmet burger dollar.

We ate here because it was close to Northwestern hospital and recommended by a friend (who works at NW). Their decor and patio are great. We ate outdoors. Service was very attentive but not overbearingly so. Prices were higher than we had expected for burgers, but seeing the size of the burgers it made a bit more sense.  Kind of a downer no sides included for the price, however. I had the Ibiza cocktail, which was very refreshing and not too heavy on the liquor, but liquor-y enough to know it was a real drink.  Not too sweet, not too sour. Try the 50/50 burger - 50% bacon and 50% ground beef - it's excellent.  So is the BBQ burger.  For the two of us, we had one 50/50 burger, a side of sweet potato fries, a side of baked red potatoes, and their fresh greens salad plus the Ibiza cocktail and a Sprecher cherry soda.  All this came to about $50.   This gruntles me a little, since I could have been a lot happier spending that $50 on different food.  But then I'm not a huge fan of  food that is fusion, or modern-American, or whatever it's calling itself these days (in the sense that it is "normal" food, like a burger or salad, that has been cuisined-up by adding pickled vegetables or artisan this-and-that, contains beets, etc).  I prefer a burger to just be a plain old burger - I'm not above trying new things, but I'm a no-frills person.  So this wasn't 100% my thing, but it was still tasty food cooked well and presently very nicely with excellent service in a lovely atmosphere, plus it's a great location.  I just wasn't expecting the pickled veggies in the salad, which was disappointing to me. It's the fact that anyone but me would be doing backflips over this place that gives it a 4 rather than a 3.

I was desperately craving a burger and a friend of mine recommended this place. At first, I was a bit skeptical because of the lavish decor but the food definitely exceeded my expectations. I normally prefer burger joints with simple decor that let the food speak for itself but I was wrong about this place. My burger was deliciously topped with onions, grilled pineapple and gouda; both the duck fat fries and sweet potato fries are highly recommended. Beer selection and service were also pretty on point.

The two stars are for Tom the bartender. He deserves 5 stars. The food is different and not satisfying. We really try to like this place as we live close. We even brought a lot of people to try it because we wanted to succeed until the blonde manager showed up and did not understand that we were spending hundreds a week there and treated us like we were in kindergarden. So now we spend the hundreds at Howels and Hood

I have been here a few times and it started out good but it keeps getting worse.  My wife ordered a regular burger and I ordered the B50 which is supposed to be half beef and half bacon.  When the order arrived they brought out two regular burgers.  They said that is what I ordered but I asked them to take the burger back.  The waitress eventually came by and apologized for putting the order in wrong.  As my wife was finishing her burger they brought out my replacement.  The fries were cold and it wasn't a B50 burger because I could not tell that there was any bacon in it.

Swing and a miss.  Tried it last night while in town.   Was hoping for a cute little neighborhood spot with a nice patio.  The patio was the only good thing about it.  Food is not horrible, although the staff was probably plucked from a cheap chain restaurant.  We like Volare (their sister place), but would not go back here.  Bummer.

Not Ideal for Vegetarians! My BF wanted to get a quick bite after a movie at the AMC.  We remembered that we wanted to try the Burger Bistro (the old Boston Blackie's location.   We figured since it offered a vegetarian option for me, it would be good.   We were seated on the outdoor deck.  The service was slightly off as it took awhile to get water. But it was the weekend, so this was to be expected.   The BF ordered the half lb. steak house burger with a side of duck fat fries.  He loved his burger and especially the fries.   I had the veggie burger with a side of traditional fries.   The fries were good.  BUT, the veggie burger was not good.  It was a veiled and failed attempt of offering a veggie option. It was also served to me lukewarm.  I was so dissatisfied that I only at a quarter of it and just ate my fries.  I was very disappointed because I was hoping to have new burger alternative over T. O'Tooles.  Well, I did not.   I would recommend the management redesign the veggie burger to be more flavorful and visually appealing (it was grayish).  So for meat eaters this is a win.  But for veggie eaters, this is a no go.  Head to T O'tooles if you want  a good veggie burger that you can custom design with you favorite add ons and still get a good meat burger for your companions.  Chitown Veg Gal

They had us at the am donut & hooked us in for lunch. Hubby & I shared the Paris burger & buttermilk onion rings & were stuffed! Sat on the patio which was great. All in all very pleased. Passing the word around to our friends!
