These burgers are amazing and I'm ALL about burgers (have tried so many in Chicago). These are very juicy and full of flavor. My burger and my sister's were both cooked to perfection, which I find many other burger places for some reason don't know how to cook the beef the way you ask. The bun is buttery and delicious and the duck fat fries are tasty as ever. Will definitely recommend this place to friends.

2nd visit, great burgers, nice hostess.....TERRIBLE SERVICE!  This time we were at the bar, thinking we would get better service, but no.....one barmaid to handle the entire restaurant.  Lazy, slow and totally indifferent.  Too bad, since the burgers are very good.
Burgers aren't worth the 12 bucks to me.Wait time was very long .40 mins to be exact.i didn't dine in so I can't tell u much about that experience .

Oh. My. Goodness! This place is amazing! I'm not a big fan of beef but since I was brought here by huge fans of the beef burger I figured I'd give it a shot. I had a burger with pickled beets on it and a side of the onion jam, I never would have thought that pickled beets on a burger would have been good but this was hands-down fantastic! The atmosphere is funky and fun and the crowd vibe is young and lively. Service, we found ourselves constantly looking for our waiter and being taken care of primarily by the manager. Kind of a downside but an upside that the manager realized guests were being left unattended and knew to jump in and take care of the table. Highly recommend...TRY IT!

He staff is very friendly, drinks are priced about average. We had some onion rings that looked good, however lacked any sort of flavor. The only dipping sauces were ketchup or dressing. Suffice to say we didn't eat very many onion rings:(. The atmosphere is nice though .

We went here on a Sunday afternoon, it was hot, and we stopped in this place to get out of the heat and get some lunch. First - we got seated quickly and in a good spot for me (with a wheelchair). Second - Francisco (sp?) our waiter kept our water glasses full, knew the menu very well, and had that perfect balance of attentive but not annoying. We started with the sangria, which was as incredible as I had hoped! I had the brisket burger, and my wife had the lamb burger. Both were perfectly cooked, and were astonishingly good. The duck fat fries were also recommended, which we split and were very good. Overall - great food and experience... Thank you!

Walking around looking for a place open a little late.  Walked in and right away I felt like I didn't belong, like they were trying very hard to be cool and I just wanted a good burger.  We were a party of 5.  We all ordered burgers and then had to order fries as they didn't come with the burgers we also all ordered milkshakes.  There was a good mix to the diners, some kids, some people just hanging at the bar, some couples.  The service was barely ordinary.  Then I got the bill and really lost it.  We were charged .$50 for lettuce!!!  Seriously.  I was also charged $.50 for my mushrooms on my burger, which would have been fine.  If they had put the dang mushrooms on the burger!  The burgers were tiny (but flavorful).  I had Sweet Potato fries which were decent and came in a cute container.  But paying $.50 for lettuce and another $.50 for pickle and not getting what I paid for really ticked me off.  No one came over to even bother to check if we were happy, which we were not.  The burgers tasted fine, the fries fine, the milkshakes good but I still left with a horrible taste in my mouth and the vow to never return.

Somedays you just want a burger, and this place delivers many delicious burger concoctions. I ordered the bistro burger, not too much bun and enough juicy meat! Brie and all the toppings. I also ordered  Deep fried pickles with a zesty ranch and two deviled eggs that come with a pickled onion.  I will say it. THE BEST DEEP FRIED PICKLES!!! Seriously  Likes: ample seating in and outside. Friendly hostess and quick service Gripes - bathroom not on same level as ground floor.

When we walked by this place a couple days ago we couldn't wait to try it. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to its appeal. Yes, the outdoor seating is nice, but that's about all it has going for itself.  Let's be honest....a good burger should be simple enough when you're a burger place, especially when you charge over $10 a burger with no sides included. Plus!!! $9 for a draft beer?!? I know it's the city of chicago, but that's ridiculous.  My Fiance's burger came out over done and the fries were cold. We were so hungry, we devoured the fries anyways, but sent back the burger. What came back out of the kitchen was an embarrassment to burgers everywhere. It was so undercooked that the burger fell apart and the cheese wouldn't melt. He ate half of it and we left. On the walk home he stated...and I quote "we should have just gone to billy goat" Don't waste your time or money

Let me start off by saying that the burgers were actually pretty good.  I had the Iberico burger and I was pretty happy with it.  That's why Chef's Burger Bistro gets two stars instead of one. If you don't care at all about value, then feel free to disregard everything I'm about to say.  I've lived in the area for a while, so I understand that the food is likely to be expensive.  So we can usually forgive $12 burgers, $8 draft local beer and $4 fries.  But for god's sake, burgers should come with fries.  And if you have to pay extra for the fries, you should get more than a handful.  Sheesh.
First time in Chicago, stopped here on a whim and loved every second. Beer and service were great!! Fun place!!

Who doesn't love a funky burger place?! I know I sure do! So when the hubby and I moved to the River North neighborhood this past month, we noticed Chef's Burger Bistro just a few blocks from our building, and made sure to check it out. The first time we stopped in was last week. We sat on the patio and really enjoyed ourselves. I had the Paris Burger and my husband, Gary, ordered the Aussie Burger which contains Wagyu meat and is absolutely delicious.   Well, after our first time visiting, we sure knew we would return. We are former restaurant owners from Miami and newly retired so checking out all the local grub places in the River North area has been so fun!  Anywho, yesterday we were on our way to a play, and decided to stop into the Bistro for a cocktail and snack before enjoying our evening on the town. We got to the restaurant around 5, and sat at the bar.  Tom, the bartender, introduced himself to us and was friendly. Shortly after being there, a young, pretty faced girl who appeared to be training behind the bar walked in and we could not help but notice the way Tom was talking to her as soon as she arrived behind the bar. He was speaking to her rather harshly and what appeared to be verbally bombarding her. Although we did not know the context, we could automatically pick up on the negative energy Tom was verbally delivering to this poor girl based off her facial expressions. We could not help but feel bad for the girl because he was talking to her in a manner that we as customers (and former restaurant owners), felt was absolutely unprofessional; especially in front of people seated at the bar. Time and place for everything.  Perhaps we noticed this more than others because we are former long-time industry people ourselves. Regardless, it was disappointing to witness. It was very evident the young girl was upset from being spoken to as she was, and we did not want to sit at the bar any longer. We skipped on the appetizer and closed out with Tom. Went to Seasons 52 for an app instead. In the future, we will return for the burgers. And definitely sit at a table, not the bar.

I just finished lunch here and thought it was fantastic. I ordered the Paris burger and it had a unique but great flavor with Brie and  caramelized onion jam. But, the highlight, don't laugh, was the organic greens salad. It had fried kale, pickled cauliflower and onions and greens in a vinegarette.  I'll try the duck fat fries next time I'm back to make up for the salad.  I sat at the bar and the service and atmosphere was great   I read some of the poor reviews so maybe I got lucky but everyone around me seemed really happy so give it a try!

The only reason I'm not giving just one star, is that my food was good. My wife's was mediocre at best. Why a bad review? Service. It started with the hostess. I believe that she will melt if she smiles for a second. She gave us a lot of attitude, pointed at a table and turned her back before we got to the table. That table was wobbly as a rocking chair, so we asked the water waiter for something to even it out. He walked and we were still waiting for menus. Some time later our actual waiter showed. We were still under the assumption that the first waiter would do something about the table, so we only asked when he came for our order. We were here for quite some time now. He went... And waited around... We got more annoyed... Had to ask the water waiter again and he finally took a piece of card board to even it out. Our food came, my duck fat fries were swimming in it, but my burger was good. My wife had a flatbread and it wasn't good. We never saw the waiter to tell him. So she finished half and left hungry. No need to say the tip was according to the service...

Dined here recently with a group of friends and I have to say, I was impressed! We requested outdoor seating because the weather's been fall-like recently and we wanted to enjoy sitting outside without our hair turning into loofahs. The manager was incredibly attentive and friendly, and it seemed that he kept the staff working at a pace which matched the comings and goings of their diners. He also seemed to have created a rapport with frequent customers because I noticed when he made small talk with them, he greeted them by name and shook their hand. I think that kind of thing is great, especially if you want your business to succeed. Our waitress was great too and the amount of times/frequency she checked on our table was just right. On to my burger! I ordered a Cuban Burger well done and, while it was something a little different than what I normally prefer (bacon on all my burgers with extra bacon on the side), I devoured every bite of it. Maybe it was the addition of the ham and pork loin, I'm not sure. Whatever it was, it was pretty damn good. I ordered regular fries and those were solid too! I have to compliment the plating for my party's meals because for being a burger joint the attentiveness to detail down to how our meals were presented was top notch!  Overall, it was a great casual dining experience and I will definitely recommend CBB to anyone who wants to give it a shot. :)

Happened to find this place while walking toward the Mag Mile. We sat out on their patio on a gorgious summer day. The burger was delicious and I will definitely come back the next time I'm in that area! Great service!

This is a more of a sports bar/place to grab happy hour than a place to enjoy a good burger. It has a clean and contemporary modern diner feel. I got a bbq burger which had an onion ring, duck fat fries, and the baked alaksa. The burger was kind of hard to eat because the brioche was so tall and the meat was small but thick. It was pretty average, not too flavorful and the buns were just ok. The duck fat fries were a little too crispy and I couldn't taste any duck fat flavor. I did enjoy the baked alaska, it was relatively cheap and the meringue was good and the ice cream was good.  Not bad for my first baked alaska, but the burger was pretty forgettable.

First off, the food here is excellent, I'm a local in the area and have been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner and there has never been an issue with the quality of food. The problem is service. I just finished up having brunch and was disappointed to see that the menu has been reduced by what looks like half; I'm especially sad to see the malted waffles no longer on the menu. But what really upset me this morning was the entirely inattentive service.  Other than taking my order and delivering the food, the waiter didn't come by once to see how I was doing, I even had to eat the lat half of my meal without anything to drink. Attempts to get any of the seven employees working to make eye contact were unsuccessful, which was insult to injury since I was one of only three diners there that morning. *If* I return, it will be because of the efforts from Tom, their bartender, who is always charming and attentive. but as of now, brunch is completely out for me. The real mystery here, and other reviewers have pointed this out, is this place is owned by the same people who own Volare, which is across the street. It is a superb Italian restaurant with consistently good service. Why there is such a complete disconnect between the two establishments is beyond me. Ultimately, this hasn't been my only bad experience with service; sometimes, it is excellent but that's only about 1/3 of the time, everything else is anywhere from lackluster to today's round of infuriating. It's a real disappointment to see this establishment fail to get traction with service and to cut back on brunch given that, for locals, there isn't much choice in walking distance besides Yolk, which is mainly geared toward the tourist crowds (and it shows given the ridiculously long waits for good, but not great food).

We have been here four times. Like the atmosphere and the food. However service has been very spotty.  We are either rushed of forgotten about. Last night took the cake, out waitress struggled with the drink orders, then when taking our dinner order left mid task to go "check on a table". Then after my husband ordered another beer she came by to ask if he would like another beer....best of all..she asked if we would like dessert before we had even been served our dinner.  They really need to upgrade the servers.

I miss Boston Blackie's. That being said, I was looking forward to the modern, new replacement. And I still miss Boston Blackie's. The service was attentive and friendly. Especially during a crowded Friday lunch. The burger was a tad odd. Like a meatball on a tiny bun. The bun, while tasty, is useless. Too small to hold everything together, it becomes a knife 'n fork meal pretty quickly, especially if you added toppings. (Ask for an extra napkin, in advance.) The burger itself was cooked as requested and flavorful. I just wish they pressed it a little thinner and used a full sized bun. Onion rings-- nothing noteworthy. Same with the bistro fries, I was told. So, that's it. Nothing special for me. I will bask in the glowing memory of my dearly departed Blackie's as I walk on by.

2 stars cause of an ok service, not too fast, not too slow. However the burger is blah ... Gave this place a 2nd try today. Burger tasted weird. Fries were cold. For a place that specializes in burgers 0 stars.
Not a fan.  Place lacks warmth and a vibe.  Not an acceptable replacement for Boston Blackie's.

Would give 3.5 but rounding up.  These are great burgers, especially for the area.  It's off the beaten mag mile, and is a welcome addition to the area in terms of quality options.  The flavor in the meat, ability to cook to requested temperature, and interesting yet sensible burger variations are strong positives.  The sides don't keep up though for their cost.  I would give the deep fried burger a chance - you only live once, like the kids say.  I am bothered that their bar exposes liquor to sunlight - that cannot be good for the booze.  Drinks were alright though.

My lunch companion, Jan, and I had decided to try this newly open restaurant in the Streeterville area.  This restaurant stands where Boston Blackies once stood.  The owners had tore down the building and built a brand new two story restaurant.  This not a Boston Blackies anymore. Upon entering this eatery, we noticed how contemporary with the light walls, the openness to the bar, just a modern feeling restaurant.  We had opted to sit on the second floor next to an open window.  The view is over the patio and of course the streets of St. Clair and Grand Avenue.   The server, Chandler, greeted us promptly and took our drink order and went over the menu with us.  Jan had ordered the Cuban Burger while I had ordered the Steak & Egg Salad.  Both of our meals were fantastic!!  Chandler would check in with us occasionally without being bothersome.  The salad is a great size - almost the size where you can share it. Of course, we had to try the desserts.... we had ordered the cobbler and the tasting dessert cookies/ice cream.  We both agree the cobbler was outstanding while the tasting dessert cookies were okay. I believe both of us would return to this restaurant.

This place ruined my day. After leaving Navy Pier, we went here because we were still really hungry and it was on the way to the train. It looked very promising. The place looked great and we got seated right away. Very inviting place, and then it went downhill. We were greeted by our waiter immediately, and he said he would be taking care of us today. About 20 minutes later, someone else came to take our drink/food orders to help our waiter out. 20 more minutes after that we got our drinks. It was two beers and a coke. It took another additional 40 minutes before we got our food. We did not see our waiter until the food came. He brought our food and we were not impressed for the price. The burgers were alright, but not worth the $15. Our fries were cold, and not worth the extra couple dollars. Our waiter came by next to give us the check. The table next to us got their order in 20 minutes after us and theirs came at the same time as ours. We asked to talk to the manager and as we explained what happened, she said, "I know, I am sorry," and she kind of just blew us off. Do not waste your time. It only gets 1 star because I cannot give zero. Worst service I have ever had.

Disappointing. Food was bleh, service wasn't any better I ordered the BBQ burger which came with sliced brisket and cheese, that's it. Brisket was the worst I've ever had, bland and rubbery, not that melt in your mouth smokey deliciousness you'd expect, it honestly tasted like it was boiled. The burger wasn't anything special, a whopper has more flavor oh and fries are extra they were actually decent. Overall I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're looking for a good burger!

I guess this place has plenty of tourists and they don't have to worry about locals returning.I won't be back.I have tried them twice and both times it was mediocre at best.The turkey burger with sweet potato jam and spinach sounded good but was dry and bland.The vegan burger was loose and fell apart.It was too loose to stay on the bun.The Sunday brunch was meh.You can get better brunch almost anywhere.

Nice outdoor patio space. The night we were there 10% of all proceeds were being donated to the Ronald McDonald House across the street supporting sick children and their families. Interesting burger menu choices which were very good.  Decent craft beer menu.

Very, very expensive for what is essentially a hamburger restaurant with a bar. This is a nice restaurant, and a huge step up from the former old Boston Blackies that was torn down to make way for something befitting the tourist locale.  New developer, new ownership team and now there's a beautiful restaurant with nicely designed spaces (walk upstairs and check out the second floor), a fabulous bar, and a menu that defines what they do best.  I had the bistro burger, a PBJ milkshake (one of the tastiest and thickest milkshakes I've ever had) and a house salad.  $20 without tax & tip.  The meat itself was fabu--tender, grilled to perfection and juicy.  The on-site-made bun was perfection.  It held everything together, even though the toppings and burger would have made the whole thing fall apart on a lesser quality bun. The house salad was fine, but it wasn't thrilling nor added anything special to the meal; just greens and a few veggies.  I wish I had ordered the onion rings--a much better value.  Avoid the fries (which is horrible to say when you're in a burger joint), but they're pricey for the paltry amount you get. The service was impeccable.  My water glass never reached half-empty, and it became comical how quickly someone refilled my glass.  I took two sips, and it was refilled.  The waiter was pleasant and attentive, and he seemed to manage a full station of diners without being absent.

ve been here three times now, and the best i can say is inconsistent.  i live in the neighborhood so i want this place to do well, and i am a big fan of volare, whose service is outstanding and food is exceptional.  so i am a tad bit disappointed by the inconsistencies. the first time i was there we didnt have a reservation, but it was fairly late on a friday night, and a snowstorm to boot.  not busy at all.  we ordered the salmon salad, the burger with the egg, the duckfat fries, and a couple of beers.  my date was disappointed by the slim selection of draft beers other than IPAs.  our server seemed overwhelmed, even thought it was pretty dead.  after we received out food which was tasty but not remarkable (considering this is the "chef burger bistro"), our waiter disappeared.  never to return.  after at least 45 minutes to an hour we finally caught the attention of the GM who i had recognized from volare.  he was super apologetic and friendly, and assured us that this was just a few growing pains and to give it another try. the next time, we didnt eat.  we just went for drinks at the bar.  there was an altercation at the bar where 2 overserved customers almost started a fight in the bar area, and the worst part was that the staff had no idea how to handle the situation.  get the party to leave?  call 9-1-1?  they stood around and basically did nothing.  we left. the third time, we made a reservation and it was again about 9:30 on a friday night.  it was quite busy, as the blackhawks playoffs were on.  but no sound.  everyone (really, everyone) in the bar area was watching the game, but music was playing.  i understand policy, but this is chicago, and this is sports, and this is the playoffs.  anyway, our waiter johnny was fantastic.  could not have been more enthusiastic.  the other staff seemed lack-luster--going thru the motions.  the food this time though, meh, not so much.  the gyro burger had sliced lamb sausage laying on top of the burger.  and it came out barely warm,  my date sent it back, and it came out still lukewarm.  the GM again was extremely accomodating, offered to bring us something else, dessert, drinks, whatever we wanted, but we really just wanted the food we ordered to be great!   i still want this place to be successful and to raise the bar.  the outdoor patio area looks great and i want to come back as the weather warms up.  i just hope that if these are indeed growing pains, that they are worked out soon, as i am not sure i can get my date to return as is.  im lowering my stars to 2, probably deserves more of a 2 1/2.  i will definitely re-yelp after my next visit.

Not much to write home about.  Ordered for delivery.  This was 2nd time giving this place a try. There won't be a 3rd, not worth it.... -they got order wrong (sent a salad instead of a chicken sandwich) -two of the salads were subpar and seemed even haphazardly prepared -they forgot to include "dressing on the side" (for both salads) -we ordered a burger done medium, and it was barely medium rare (very pink) -order of duck fat fries is really just too small

Stopped in this place to order take-out for my ride back to west burbs and I was very impressed with my orders.  I ordered the fried pickles for starts. A build your own burger with provolone cheese, mushrooms and charred onions. A streak burger without streak sauce and two orders of duck fat fries. When I got home the burgers were still hot. I did put the fries and pickles in the oven for a quick second and everything was perfect. The burgers were charred perfectly and the mushrooms were plump and fresh. The buns were buttery and the duck fat fries are a MUST! I will be back and hopefully enjoying a dine-in experience. The restaurant looked very modern and had a great feel to it.

Id give this place a half star if I could. We entered at 10 - which was late - and asked them if we can get a table- which they readily gave us. The waiter however was rude and extremely impatient with us - he clearly could not wait for us to leave since we were close to the kitchen being shut. Half of our sides to our dishes never came - we ordered sweet potato fries which never came. The burger patties themselves were not firm and more like stuffing. The worst part was the food poisoning I went through later as a result of my caesar salad. I would def never recommend this place to anyone

Came here for drinks after work on a Friday. It was pretty empty. The drinks were good and the food looked good. The service was just ok. The server we had was a bit odd. The patio is nice and they have a nice upstairs area.

First time trying out this place since they recently opened (this was the old blackie's burger).  The place was recently renovated and it looks great and fitting to the location.  The inside decor is very modern and plenty of room from what I can see.  I only placed my order via phone for pick up.  I ordered a burger medium well, a chicken sandwich, carnitas tacos, shakes, and fries.  The packaging and presentation was very nice.  Now let's review the food --- the burger was tiny, dry and was plain.  Maybe it was my error but the online menu was not clear of what goes with it.  I assumed all the fixin' on the description came with it and they did not ask me what I want with it.  The tacos were tiny and the carnitas were were hard and chewy, again dry, almost like a beef jerky.  The chicken sandwich was a big portion but when I took a bite on the mid area (where the thickest part of the meat), it was pink and uncooked.  The fries and the shakes were OK but not great.  So in all, the best review I can give is for the decor.

My lady and I came here to watch the game and have a good burger. Boy were we disappointed! After confirming with the hostess that the game would be played. Slowly but surely they switched all the TVs from the game to something else. The manager was not accommodating or apologetic.... To top it off the burger was tasteless and dry. The service was very slow. They were out of sweet potatoes fries and all chicken . . . . how does that happen???? We won't be back! I would also advice you not to go either.

Not sure why their ratings are so low. The burger was great and the sauces were excellent. Water and soda glasses were kept full. I highly recommend the onion rings as a side. The second floor is pretty cool too the windows open and the fresh air makes it seem like you're eating outside when you are inside which is nice.  Give them a shot, you won't be disappointed.   :)

We placed our order and 5 other tables, seated after us, got their food first. It wasn't the waitresses fault but the kitchen. Once we got our food it was mostly cool so we sent our onion rings back. We were told we were getting new onion rings but instead got our old rings back, more deep fried.  Not good. Not at all recommended. And $71 total for the bill?! Forget it.

Service was slow.....fries were not worth the price for $2.50 just a few fries ! I ordered a Ruben Sandwich and it was OK...just OK. Waitress came and just flung the plates down on our table....and left rudely ! $45.00 check should be better than just ok !
Awesome atmosphere. Great food. I ordered the Bistro burger. I thought 1/3 pound would be more than enough, but I'd actually suggest ordering the 1/2 burger!

I'd picked up Burger Bistro to go but finally had the chance to dine it. I would definitely recommend this place! I went with a group of 8. Everyone loved their food. Don't be fooled by the name - the burgers are delicious but they have a lot more to offer. I had the shrimp tacos and they were awesome.   Delicious and reasonably priced food, great beer list, good spot for big groups, awesome service, fun atmosphere!

Walking downtown heading to a movie and followed the bbq aroma in the neighborhood. Looked crowded, usually a good sign, so thought we had an hour and a half before movie so we would check it out. Walked in and gave our name to a host who appeared to be more concerned with talking to her coworkers then assisting patrons. We were told approximately a ten minute wait if we weren't looking to sit on patio. After thirty minutes, and seeing some peoples names added to the list. While others who didn't have reservations (standing within earshot of hostess stand so heard these people state they did not have reservations, same size party as mine) seated immediately. I approached the hostess station to ask about the extended wait time as well as seating priority. Though she just seated a couple who walked in with no reservation she stated she had no idea what I was talking about. While talking with one hostess, a couple arrived and spoke to the other hostess stating they had a reservation but were told that things were a bit behind and it would be approximately a thirty to forty five minute wait. Based on other reviews, as well as my thirty minute observation. The staff doesn't appear to have any want to be there nor assist customers. Witnessed many customers speaking to other waitstaff or bus staff trying to get anyone to wait on them. Some staff seemed so disinterested, while others seemed to have that 'attitude' to themselves, forgetting they are employed in a relatively inexpensive establishment. So attitude is not really necessary. Regarding food I can't address, based on most reviews here it appears we didn't miss anything. We ended up leaving and went across the street to Volare. Where one can always count on great food, great service for a very reasonable price. At Volare, management/owner/host all stop by to check on service and quality of meal. The couple who had the reservation and were told they would still have to wait thirty to forty five minutes. They were right behind us at Volare. Hopefully the staff will learn to treat their patrons with a bit more respect and be a bit more attentive. The issues may be related to the newness of staff and restaurant and just related to growing pains. Either way most likely won't be heading back anytime soon.
I'm angry how bad this is. Sat for 20 minutes before ordering, waited 20 more for the drink. Got our 8 fries delivered with a bad attitude.

walking in downtown. me and my daughter enjoyed the smell of this place so we decided to give it a try. the atmosphere is great. patio was a 30 minute wait so we decided to settle for a window table on the second floor.  this place will do good because of the specialty burgers, but i wasnt a fan. i ordered the classic burger. the meat was excellent but the special sauce they put on it killed it. i hated the fact that i ended up eating the meat alone without the bun. my daughter ordered the bbq brisket. huge sandwich. she seemed to enjoy it,although she complained about having cheese when we ordered it without. I would come back here for a hang out with friends but wont make a special trip for it though. ive had better burgers for the price. average burger is 12-14. P.S our waiter lacked customer service skills.  Strawberry milk was ok.

We stumbled upon Chef's Burger Bistro when wandering around looking for dinner in the city.  I was especially drawn to it since it had a cute outdoor patio which I'm a sucker for.  My friend and I had no problem being seated since we came pretty late for dinner, around 930pm on a Saturday.  I wish I could rate it higher but my experience here was a bit lacking. 1) Loved the outdoor patio, especially since it's still not too common in Chicago due to our unpredictable weather 2) Service was meh.  Our server was pretty bland and acted like he could care less being there 3) Food was decent but nothing outstanding.  I had the B50 burger which was half beef, half bacon belly with swiss cheese, an egg, and aioli.  I asked for it cooked medium but when it came out it was definitely well done.  What I did like about the burger was the nice smoky flavor and aioli sauce.  My friend had the French Dip burger which was a burger topped with sliced prime rib.  He wasn't too satisfied with it since it was too soggy and the burger was trying to do too much..adding the prime rib and au jus kind of overpowered the burger itself.   If you're looking for a nice outdoor patio to have drinks at night, I'm sure it would be fun with a group of friends.  If you're looking for good food, probably skip coming here and go across the street to Volare (literally) for some yummy Italian!

Our host was nice but our waiter was not into it. Quick to get an answer and then he'd run off.  The burgers were decent. I had the French dip burger, which was definitely tasty but hard to keep together (because of the au jus) and messy. Next time I'd get a simple burger because the patties are really good on their own. We also got the B50 burger which is half beef half ground pork belly or bacon or something. It was very rich, so I didn't like it much, but my friend destroyed it (so give it a shot!). There is a very strong smokey aftertaste to it too, if you're into that.  Outdoor seating is really nice on a warm night too

I created a Yelp account just to review this place. While visiting over the weekend, a hotel employee kindly directed my group to this spot. It was the perfect brunch stop! House-made donuts that were delicious, perfect mimosas, amazing egg dishes that had us all sharing, and stellar sausage & bacon. I recommend the rustic eggs & the cheeseburger omelette- both were wonderful. Our service was warm and friendly, everything was quick, and the bill was quite reasonable. I am looking forward to a return visit!

I was so stoked at the idea of specialty burgers in the neighborhood... ouch. I'll start by saying my first experience was via GrubHub, but I only live 8 blocks away. I built a burger, ordering it medium. It was barely warm and well-done... the driest burger I've ever eaten.  Conversely, the Bistro Fires were soggy and limp. The fries, however, don't have to be soggy. It's a packaging issue. Don't seal them up in a small box. They need to breath not steam in their own heat. I get Spring Rolls delivered 5 miles in a vented box and they are as crispy at home as sitting in the restaurant. I also ordered the Trio Donut Bites. The menu gives you options and instead of getting what I ordered... I got one of each. They were mediocre. I hope they don't have a long term lease.

I love a big fat sloppy burger! If I need to use a fork half way through a burger...then thats the one I want. So for months I have been wanting to try this place out and I finally made it there! I ordered the BBQ burger and boy did I get exactly what I wanted a super sloppy meal. However, this was not a good burger at all. The brisket that comes on top of the patty was horrible!!! It was not edible and after two bites I pulled it off. I honestly felt that someone had just taken a tub of beef, slapped some BBQ on it and threw it on my burger. Okay so I was left with a burger that was killed with BBQ sauce...which I'm okay with. But the burger itself was tasteless. Even with BBQ on it...not good. As for the BBQ sauce itself...also bad. Just not a good burger and I hate to say this but it was not worth my money, time, nor calories towards my day. The duck fat fries...tasted like regular fries. I'm willing to give another burger a try but wont go out of my way to do so. There are much better burger places out there folks and this one is just too expensive to try.

I so wanted to like this place me my lady and our two kiddies came in on a pretty slow Monday night........ Service- one star, Emily I believe her name was very bland didnt really seem as though she didnt want to be there or just wasn't interested in her job, absolutely no personality (not to be mean) but we didnt really need much Ambiance- two stars its nice... Food- one star again here the lobster roll one of the worse I've had in the city honestly and at $18 bucks its truly bad and what type of salad was that (high acid no balance just not good) The duck fat fries just pass on it it literally taste like regular fries there is no added flavor here, the sweet potato fries were good. The Paris Burger was good not great, the pork loin burger was below average....... Cost - $62 plus a 13 dollar tip (Im industry so I tip even for subpar service) so it was pretty much 75 down the drain. I will not return and I advise you not am to also......

Finally got to visit this place. Everyone was very nice, the service was excellent. Unfortunately I don't think I will return. I ordered the make your own burger. 1/3 lb with American cheese, lettuce  and tomato.  I wish restaurants that ask you how you want it cooked, would actually do as asked. I ordered it med rare and it was a hockey puck! DON 'T ASK!!!!!! It comes unadorned. The presentation is nothing. Ordered the Yukon gold potatoes, came ice cold. Not very appetizing. $30 for two bad burgers, anorder of bad fries, and cold Yukon gold potatoes. Never again.

Wouldn't know what to tell you. Sat at the bar for 15 minutes with only a small crowd in the place. Bartender finally asked what he could get me & as I started to answer he turned his back to talk to a bar back & didn't return before cashing out two more people. I walked out. Bring back the friendly Blackies women..

Oh chef's burger bistro, so many rookie mistakes but you are a rookie, so hopefully you'll get sorted.  Walk in to the restaurant (which is beautifully appointed and slick) on the opening day of baseball season to find their TV's tuned to a post game recap of a premier league game, meanwhile the Cubs are all tied up with the Pirates in the 4th.  Order an iced tea and its cloudy as all get out (which I find very unappealing and so easy to solve!) Ordered the "Second City In & Out Burger" which I thought looked to be the simplest on the menu due to the description "creamy cheddar, lettuce, tomato".   I figured it was their take on an In-n-Out burger, but it was actually a cheddar stuffed burger that vomited brown oily cheddar onto my plate when I pressed the top bun down before taking my first bite.  The menu already appears to have been tweaked since their opening so at least they are being proactive.  Also, was a little sad to see some pretty decent whiskeys being stored in direct sunlight.

The Paris burger was nothing special. I asked for medium and my burger was very well done. The prices are too high for a not so great burger...too much competition in Chicago. We waited about an hour for our food, despite the fact that it was not crowded. The waitress was rude. She brought us the check even though we wanted to order dessert. At one point she snatched the menu away and said the kitchen did not have any donuts left. Weird. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

We tried Burger Bistro last Saturday night and had the luxury of eating outside...which I have to say is a big highlight.  The outside seating is really nice and connect to the bar.  Hard to describe but very cool. The food was okay.  We got the lamb burger - which was gyro meat on top of a burger.  The gyro meat and bun were good, but it was all just too much meat for me.  My husband got the Iberico - which he said was pretty good.  We didn't get sides - just opted for the Baked Alaska.  It was not something to write home about and I would suggest skipping it. I did get a Deville drink and I will say that was quite good.  I would have gotten another, but our waitress (Rory) was awful.  Completely unfriendly and did not smile the entire time we were there.  She could barely be bothered to help us or come take our orders.  And after seeing other customers' expressions outside, we weren't the only ones who thought Rory needed an attitude adjustment. Would we go again?  Maybe - but not sure we would seek it out.

It's a cool venue, and a good burger. Just not a burger that left me craving for more.  The food: We both ordered our burgers medium-rare, but they came out more well-done than we expected (and I feel like a brat for being nit-picky like that). The B50 burger - cool concept. Instead of the usual bacon on top of the burger, they mixed the bacon and beef together.  The Paris burger - the weird thing is that this is probably the best "smelling" burger I've ever had. I think the Jam added a unique scent and taste to it. I don't think I've had a burger quite like this before.  The duck-fat fries - I didn't see what the big deal was about these fries. Some reviews mentioned them but they didn't taste any different from usual restaurant fries.  Our server was also strangely lifeless. I thought it was just me but then my friend brought it up after she left the table: "well it certainly seems like she loves working here."  While I would come back, it's not a place I'd bring up first when figuring out where to eat in the area.

I've come here about 3 times now, every time it gets a bit better. The service can still use an improvement. 2 out of the 3 times we've been our waiter disappeared for like 10 minutes and we had to flag someone else down to order a new round of drinks. First of all, the bar there is awesome. They have tons of unique beers that you don't find that often in Chicago, and the other cool part about it is that it's half inside, then half outside on their patio since big windows open up and you can sit at the window and order there. Their bartenders are also very friendly and have great recommendations, so just ask them what they recommend. The most recent time we were there, we ate outdoors on the patio which is always clutch on a nice night in Chicago. Their strawberry milkshake is very good, it was my first time ordering a shake there and wasn't sure if they were going to make it all fancy and ruin the flavor, but it was amazing and I drained that sucker so fast.  Their steakhouse burger is definitely tastey and has a lot of flavor. The Paris burger always seems to be a popular choice for girls.  Most recently I got the French Dip burger, but regretted not going with the B50 Burger (half burger half bacon belly). My french dip burger didn't have that much flavor and was more medium than medium rare.  The Tuna Bahn Mi also looked very good, but I haven't had a chance to try it yet. Their onion rings are also great.  Make sure you save room for dessert! Get the cookie in the skillet, it's amazing and you won't regret it.

Went here for brunch...had the 50 burger (half bacon/half beef ground together). Had an egg on it as well...really tasty and definitely a napkin user...:). Kids had omlettes and eggs and enjoyed as well!!  Full and happy!!  Recommend highly!

I went in for lunch today and had the maine lobester roll wi the sweet potato fries. It was my first time and I loved it. Our server, katie, asked out names and called us by them throuhhtout the meal. She was very knowledgable, friendy, and super attentive. The food was great. Defintely more than a burger joint. I will be back there for sure

This place is definitely impressive. Love the decor and atmosphere. An upscale burger joint is unique, but good. Went for lunch with co-workers and were sat on the second floor. The windows were open and it had a nice breeze coming in. The bar looks like a great place to go to after work for a drink too. Our waiter was phenomenal. I really wish I could remember his name. Great personality. Very knowledgeable.  I got the Iberico burger. I would highly recommend it. The fries were good too. My friend got the Paris burger and she really liked that too. Burgers are priced on the higher end, but it's definitely worth it for a nice lunch once in a while. I will most certainly be going back.

This place as a really great vibe and good service ... All the food at served in small portions. When you order. $10-15 burger you still have to spent $2-4 more for fries and other sides. They don't have any drink specials there either. We got the green leaf salad with Brussels sprouts which want mixed well with the dressing but it was still tasty. We also go the Paris burger which was very small and over hyped and also the vegan burger which was dry and actually pretty gross.

Ate there a couple of times before and really like the burgers. Fries, onion rings, and burgers all good.  Today we found out they just started serving breakfast. I had the Mediterranean eggs and my wife ordered the waffle. Excellent.... My wife said it's the best waffle she ever had. Eggs were very good...sent back a clean plate. Service very attentive and friendly.  We'll be back and can't wait for the outside patio to open up.

Amazing. Come hungry. There's soo much food. And definitely get the chocolate milkshake. Hmmmmmm. We had the cornbeef burger and the east coast. Sooo yummy. Cooked to perfection. Definitely will go again.

We happened upon the burger bistro as we drove through Chicago. The Paris Burger and Steakhouse Burger were definite hits at our table. The combination of brie and candied tomatoes was scrumptious. Great environment, service was terrific. Hope to repeat in the future if I get back to Chicago.

I thought the food was delicious.   We had an Chicago in and out burger with fries.   The kale salad us delicious as well.   Burger bistro might be be in the top 5 burger joints in Chicago.  The staff was also very attentive.   Give it a try and you won't be disappointed.

Their burgers are great, their service is timely and friendly, the prices aren't egregious and the I believe the food is worth more than they charge.  I had the iberico, a burger with manchego cheese and serrano ham; the manchego was melted perfectly, the burger was juicy but not underdone. The burger came out to 12 dollars after tax and tip.  Would definitely recommend to others.

I walk in and am immediately seated, given a menu, and brought water.  I ordered a build-your-own burger (230 grams or a half-pound) with bacon (thick, meaty, delicious), jalapenos (fresh and char grilled just a touch) and blue cheese.  The burger was cooked perfectly - medium rare; browned and aromatic on the outside, pink but definitely cooked through on the inside.  Their ketchup is local, and from a glass bottle; and clearly fresh. They initially forgot the bacon; I asked the server if I had ordered bacon.  Without skipping a beat or pausing to look at my order, he said I certainly had, and was back in less than thirty seconds with my burger, still steaming hot, with bacon as requested.  It came out to 15 dollars with tax and tip, I paid in cash, and I was out of there in less than 45 minutes.  This place gives attention to their food and their customers, which is the highest accolade I can give a restaurant. Food 5/5 Service 5/5 Price $$

Came to Chicago with friends for a long weekend.  Stumbled upon BB since it was right down the steps from our Marriott.  What a great find.  The 8 of us took seats at the bar and were immediately welcomed by the bartender Tom.  He was so welcoming and was so accommodating making us cocktails to our specifications with no attitude or problem.  He was at the end of his shift but stayed on the chat with us about the city and where and what to do.  He was GREAT!  Then we were handed over to Julie who picked up right where Tom left off.  Just a fun, warm and engaging young lady.  Met the owner Chef Ed who also was working the restaurant making everyone feel at home and welcome.  The hostess Kate did a great job of also making us feel welcome.  We had some appetizers since we were going out for a large dinner and I can say that they were done excellent and presented like a 5 star restaurant.  The time we spent there along with the people we met was one of the highlights of our trip.  They were all great!!

Another great evening. Didn't think it could get better but it did. We started with Bookers Bourbon and Lamb Tacos, they were fantastic. They had a seafood special appetizer my family ordered that they all raved about. Then the burgers came with 3 sides of fries for the table, sweet potato, regular and duck fat.  All were exactly what the doctor ordered, all cooked to perfection, and all hit the spot. I ordered the BBQ brisket on top of the large burger no bun. Amazing burger, and with place hopping it was a great evening. Be back again soon, can't wait for warm weather and the outdoor patio. See you all there.

Updated review: reduced to 3 stars.  Something has happened to this place - the last 3 times we've come here the food quality just isn't what it was.  Plus they took the chicken fried burger off the menu.  Original review follows: The five stars are for the flavor ridiculousness of the Chicken Fried Burger. Unbelievable.  This place keeps getting better and better, brunch is great, always check the quiche of the day.  This area needed a solid food choice and this is it.  The brunch homemade doughnuts are awesome too!

TERRIBLE customer service. We walked in and ask to sit at the bar. The first guys says yes that's fine, a second guy walks up to tell us he will bring us drinks/menu, the third guy then tells us he doesn't want us sitting there. Talk about whiplash! I couldn't understand the lack of communication and bad representation. Maybe their food is enough to make up for it but I could not be a reference on account of their poor service.

Amazing in more then one way. Brunch on Sundays was outstanding. The service just classy. Lunch and dinner just perfect to hangout with friends or family. Catch the game and have a great dinner with better then just bar food. Burgers to die for. A spot every local should frequent and every our of town visitor should wanna come check out.

I was totally impressed with my experience. The staff and service were great.  Service was fast and awesome and the serving staff was warm and friendly. A wonderful additional to Streeterville.   Burgers we ordered were perfect and quite tasty.  I plan to visit again this great new spot.

I'm surprised by the negative reviews because I had a pretty good meal here. I got the Iberico burger which was very good. (Manchego cheese, serrano ham, a (perfectly cooked) egg, and garlic aoil). We also had sweet potato fries that were excellent, although the order was small and it irks me when restaurants don't automatically bring ketchup, but make you ask. The charcuterie plate we started with was just okay, but I was impressed by the beer selection. Overall, the food was good even though the decor of the place is confusing and the service a bit awkward. I'll definitely be back though- it's new, so maybe they're ironing out the kinks.

Had a great burger and looking forward to going again and trying another.  I went with a group of 4 for lunch on a Monday. Showed up at 12pm and the main seating area was already 75% full, but we did not have to wait at all for a table.  All staff whom we encountered seem to go out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  We sat at a large, 6-seat elevated (bar height) table.  The interior has the look and feel of a contemporary bar.  There aren't a lot of seats on the main floor, but we were told that there is additional seating upstairs, which is only open on Fridays and weekends right now.  The noise level was not obvious; I don't even recall hearing music, and I would classify it as conversation-friendly, at lunchtime.   As for the most important part -- the food, my group was pretty well satisfied.  There were a number of items on the menu that caught our attention, but we all had burgers.  I had one of the chef's "signature" burgers, the Iberico, that comes dressed with Manchego cheese, Serrano ham, a fried egg and garlic aioli.  I had the 145 gram burger (which is a 1/3 lb. burger) -- and given the size of the burger, I would guess that they are generous on their portioning.  I probably could not have finished the larger burger option.  I loved the flavor combination of the Iberico burger.  The meat was cooked exactly as I had ordered it (medium).  The beef itself had a decent, but not prominent taste.  There was no overt "char" or grilled flavor to the burger patty.  Overall, it was a delicious burger -- not quite on par with the best I've had (Au Cheval, Grange Hall, The Butcher & the Burger), but pretty close.  I felt it was fairly priced, too.  The 1/3 lb. Iberico burger was just $9. Having paid $12 - $18 for gourmet burgers elsewhere, I felt as if I got a decent value. I did have higher expectations from the duck fat fries.  In fact, had I not known ahead of time that they were duck fat fries, I would have just thought they were regular fries.  Here, Chef's Burger Bistro can learn a thing or two from Au Cheval.  One of my companions mentioned that the onion rings were utterly ordinary. The service was friendly and attentive.  However, my soft drink went empty for way too long, and the server only noticed it after we had finished our meal.   But, in the end, Chef's Burger Bistro passes the important test:  we will be back again.  The plethora of options/toppings is unique and I definitely want to try more burger combinations.

Very good service overall with a couple of minor hiccups. Waitress asked our first names and called us by name during our lunch. I was missing an item I ordered in my burger, the onions. Build your own charges for every item, including 75¢ for lettuce. The burger was tasty and nicely presented. I would definitely return. Nice clubby-bar atmosphere.

Such a strange little space.  It's laid out like a bar.  Not particularly cozy or welcoming.  I went with my girl and we were seated in a big half-circle booth.  Strange to be seated *next* to my date instead of across from her. As we looked out from our table, we saw the bar and beyond it, a parking garage.  It's a real treat when someone turns on their car and blinds you with their headlights as you're trying to eat.  Above the bar were two plasma TVs that lost their signal and briefly went to black every 5-10 minutes. I made my own burger with bacon and mozzerella.  It was okay, but I've had far better burgers elsewhere in Chicago (Kuma's, 25 Degrees, even Five Guys).   For my side, the server recommended the mini fingerling potatoes, but they tasted gross.  They were coated in some kind of weird oil that tasted like WD-40 or something.  I tried using salt, butter and even ketchup without much success. A bus boy came over and tried to steal my girl's plate while she still had half a burger on it. I realize food options are slim-to-none in Streeterville, but I recommend passing on the Burger Bistro.
One of the best burgers I've had in some time!  An enjoyable meal with really great food.  Wait staff was attentive and friendly.  Excited to return soon.

The atmosphere alone was enough to turn me off, turn me around, and push me right back out the door. It's very dark, with seating limited to a large bar, several booths, and a few high-top tables with stools. No regular tables with chairs.  All the seating was not taken, but several people were waiting to be seated, Never a good sign.  But it was the music -- so bad I'm sorry I heard it, and I hope I never hear its like again -- played at a level too loud for talking to be heard -- that really drove me away. I just couldn't imagine staying another minute in that room, much less eating a meal to it. The hostess didn't greet me when I came in. I said to her, "I was going to eat here, but now I'm not." She didn't reply, or ask me why. I left.

Seriously, at noon on a Saturday and they don't even serve a hamburger when their name is Burger Bistro???  I came to Boston Blackie's at this location every Saturday for 10 years.  I came here once and will NEVER be back.  The service was horrible, the food was barely edible, and I would need to increase my credit limit just to pay for their rediculously priced food.  Really, two small, poor tasting shrimp tacos on a soaking wet tortilla that fell apart when picked up were $9 on the menu, but $10 when the check came.   I should have seen it coming when they asked what kind of water I wanted at a BURGER joint???????? RIP Boston Blackies!!

There are rare jewels that totally blow your mind and Chef's Burger Bistro is one of them. in so many ways I know I'll have to come back sooner than later From the time I walked in the door, I was greeted with true hospitality... like a hostess who asked me "How are you doing today" and actually meant it with a follow up conversation that she kept occasionally stopping by our table and continuing. The service was fast and awesome, and the serving staff seemed pleasant in an area of town where the people who give us service can feel like Walking Dead extras is so very refreshing.  Chef is awesome. He even came by our table and talked with us for a few about the menu and made us a little something special that knocked my socks off. I don't even like Avocado and he brought me some fried avocado that made me a fan My Tuna burger was the BEST I ever had in my life. like I literally wont have another Tuna burger anywhere else unless bribed or held down and forced to suck liquified tuna burger through a straw. It was moist and flavorful without being "fishy" at all. It was a very fresh cut of Tuna, definitely top -tier Sushi grade. the fingerling potatoes were nice and warm without being blazing hot. just a perfect lunch time meal. And the price is excellent for a lunch time gourmet burger. The ambiance was great as the decor fit the layout well and the music selection was pretty bad ass. It never felt like a club, it felt like a great place to have lunch and never feel over or underdressed for the occasion. great natural light! The only thing I even found remotely offcenter was the website, it didn't properly prepare me for the awesomeness that would be my lunch.

Just off Michigan Avenue (near Nordstrom) for all of you out of of towers. Just down the block from where I live. I had a great experience ordering out today for Chefs Bistro Burger. For reference, I picked up my food at 4:50 pm. 1st time visiting the Bistro..The 1st level is a cool vibe Bar feel..Upstairs feels more like a restaurant. It looks like they have a patio for when Chiberia leaves us. I called up and ordered the Iberico Burger and Salad with Chicken. I arrived 20 minutes later when told the food would be ready. 2 very nice Hostesses were there to greet me. Food was ready as promised. The Iberico Burger was excellent..Cooked just as asked..Maybe a little pricey, really good. The Salad with Chicken (other choice is Salmon) was excellent too..It might be my new goto pickup salad in Chicago..The chicken was really tasty..Had a great smokey flavor..Came with an egg, avocado, and great veggies..The menu is very diverse and I'm excited to go back to try other things..Thanks for coming to my neighborhood.

My friend and I dropped by for brunch this weekend. The service was excellent--our server was really kind, friendly and fun. We ordered two doughnuts (the strawberry shortcake one was particularly good). We also had to try the burgers, so we shared the breakfast burger and the Paris burger. Though I preferred the Paris burger (the onion jam is delicious)--both burgers were quite good. The French fries were hot and crispy and excellent. Especially in a neighborhood without one single decent burger, I am very happy that this place opened. The restaurant is also beautiful. Can't wait for this winter to be over to sit on the giant patio! Please give this place a try.

Went for second time. Pros, very good burgers. Nice wine by the glass options. Pastrami/ corned beef sandwich was huge and delicious for $10. Great deal. Cons, need to work on fries. And an appetizer that isn't fried or very fattening would be nice.

Wouldn't you think that if you're pretentious enough to name your restaurant Chef's Burger Bistro, that you'd serve excellent burgers and not the bland, flavorless ones we got?  And if you're bragging about French fries fried in duck fat they wouldn't be limp?  We all were amazed by how boring the food was.  However, if you like anchovies, you might like the Caesar salad.

I came here today with 3 coworkers. They had heard about it opening so we thought we should check it out. Upon arrival, we were told it would be a 10-15 minute wait. No problem it was lunch time so I figured we would. After waiting 20 minutes they said it would be another 10 for a table unless we sat at the bar. So we did. The bartender was nice when we sat, then completely ignored us. She was busy, I get it  but that doesn't mean she should ignore us. I had an empty glass for 20 minutes. After 35 minutes we got our food. Nothing special at all. Expensive and bland. They have a fancy presentation for their food and restaurant, but I've had better food from Burger King.  Hopefully they'll change something...everything. They were rude and didn't care if you wanted to tell them something negative. I would highly recommend NEVER going to this place. Pity since burgers are so good and usually easy.

Went here the other day for lunch with friends .... so glad we did!! We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to tell us about the specials. The atmosphere was lively and they had good tunes playing in the background.  I ordered the Chicago In & out and it was cooked exactly the way I had asked for it . The bistro fries were delicious and a perfect compliment to the burger. With plenty of other tasty items on the menu to choose from there is something for everyone. I would highly recommend this place...

This will be one of the hot spots in Chicago once the warm weather finally gets here. The staff was super friendly, the food was delicious, and I don't think they played a bad song all night. Once the patio (with fireplace) and rooftop open, this place will be jumpin. The Iberico burger is definitely the burger to start with if it's your first time there. We had the fried avocados and peppers, and everyone at the table enjoyed them. The onion rings, sweet potato and duck fat fries are the perfect compliments to whatever burger you choose. We will be coming back often!

I'm happy this place finally opened. As a Streeterville resident, I welcome any and all attempts to contribute to the feeding of the neighborhood, which is growing in population by leaps and bounds. The menu is good, burgers and salads and sides, and the atmosphere is eclectic. Service needs to be worked on, but I  think this will be alright. I had a sausage and peppers burger with a side of roasted vegetables. Very delicious!

I hate giving any restaurant a one star review so early in its run, but I am already hoping Chef's closes its doors quickly and makes room for any other eatery...maybe even a decent burger joint. In short I had a tough time deciding which was worse, the lack luster food or the incredibly rude staff. In the end I'm going to call it a tie and give Chef's the single star which it so justly deserves. Maybe they can get their act together, but if not I'm sure anything else in that building can do better - the location is good and the space itself is well done.

Terrible service.  Came in for a carryout order and had to wait an additional 20 minutes after they had told me the food (for 2) would be ready.  They only had 2 chefs working at 8:30 PM on a Tuesday night. I would attribute this to simple growing pains, but the flippant attitude of both the hostess and remainder of the staff makes me think it's something else.  This place may go the way of Boston Blackie's and the last place that was around here (Grami?)  They need to get it together, and quickly.  The food itself was decent, but nothing better than other similar restaurants.

I visited this place for brunch and was very satisfied. For the decor, service and food quality you expect for an expensive downtown price point; however the prices were very reasonable. I added photos of my brunch inside the app. I wasn't too found of the strawberry donut because it was a little too sweet for my taste, but if you like sweet then go for it. I loved everything else about it I will visit again you can tell this place is going to be a staple real soon.

Very disappointed as we have been waiting a long time for this place to open. We live very close by. Our main complaint is the burger bun. My wife ordered the Thai tuna burger and I ordered the Bistro Burger (145 grams). It seems that they have one sized bun for all burgers. Both fillings were very good but they were completely overpowered by the bun. All we could taste was bread. Perhaps I should have ordered the 235 (grams) for a perfect bun match. Also, please lose this gram thing. It's very annoying.

This place was beyond amazing! From the decor to the staff and food I was not disappointed. I hade the Strawberry Shortcake donut, waffle, bistro potatoes, and bacon. It was great!!! I can not wait to try their burgers next! The prices were good for the quality and amount of food.

I'm giving Chef's Burger Bistro 2 stars, BUT I'm sure once they work out some of the new restaurant kinks they can make this place a 3 star restaurant. I've been waiting for this place to open since FOREVER!! I live so close to the location and was always seeing the sign saying opening on this date, opening on that date. So when they finally opened I was thrilled because I always like it when new eating spots open in my neighborhood and because I love burgers. I went to Chef's Burger Bistro with a friend and we thought: Positives 1) Everyone was super friendly from the time we entered the establishment until the time we walked out. 2) They have a nice menu of cocktails and beers. 3) Nice selection of burgers and I like that you can build your own as well. 4) They have a nice size patio, which I am sure will be a hit come the summer time for Happy Hours. Negatives 1) Space wise it's a little tight on the 1st floor. The 2 person tables are right up against each other so I had the pleasure of having my chair bumped every time the lady behind me moved. Also, there's like no walk space for the staff between the bar and the tables. While the waitress was trying to take our orders about 7 staff members walked by and she had to lean into our table to let them by. 2) Lacking Red Bull and BBQ sauce. My friend ordered a vodka & red bull, but they had no red bull. My friend asked for a side of BBQ and was told they didn't have BBQ sauce. In this day and age every restaurant with a functioning bar NEEDS to have red bull. I mean I don't like red bull, but I'd think that 1 out of every 50 customers would ask for a vodka red bull. Also, I would think that every restaurant serving burgers would be stocked with BBQ sauce...maybe I'm wrong. 3) Food was a little bland.       - We ordered the devilish eggs, and you get 6 of them which is AWESOME and they all have different fillings, BUT they were bland which was totally disappointing. I feel like if they had added some type of seasoning to the filling these would have been so much better.     - The burgers (we both did the build a bite burger) were a good size, but we both agreed they war flavorless. Again, I feel these burgers would have been so much better if they had some flavor. I mean give me some garlic salt, seasoning salt, heck any McCormick or Mrs. Dash seasoning would have helped. 4) The waitress waiting on us could not tell us which drinks on the cocktail menu were her favorite because she hadn't tried any of them. Unless she is underage or in AA, I don't understand how you can work somewhere that serves alcohol and not have tried one drink on the menu. I feel bad being so negative and rating this place 2 stars since they just opened, HOWEVER, I really do think this place will get some of these things worked out and get to that 3 - 31/2 star range soon (hopefully).

Don't go! Leave more room for me. Can't go wrong on the burger menu. Going back tomorrow morning for brunch, I am so happy they have opened. Right down the street from me, with an outdoor patio. Ahhh.

Amazing atmosphere with delicious food!!!...Definitely the new spot to eat well....The staff are amazingly friendly and happy to see you walk through the door. The rolls are fresh and soft, the burgers are hand crafted and complimented with high quality ingredients and I especially loved the duck fat and sweet potato french fries. I plan to eventually try everything on the menu!!!

I've visited twice this week and can't wait to go back!  I plan on trying everything on their menu.  The staff is extremely helpful and the food was all around amazing!   I recommend the wings and shrimp tacos!   As far as the burgers are concerned you're safe with any choice.  Extremely tasteful and a great size!   It's a great addition to the area.

My nifty boss saw that the place had finally opened today and took a few of us out for lunch. The place is great with comfy booths and really nice decor.  It also looks as if it is set up for an open pass-through bar (to the exterior once the weather warms up).  The outdoor patio is going to be amazing. As for the food, it was delicious.  Those at the table ordered the In and Out (cheddar stuffed and cheddar topped) which was pretty amazing.  The duck fat fries were really good.  We also ordered the fried pickles which were outstanding--especially with the honey mustard dressing. Overall the experience was nice.  They had the typical opening day jitters--food took almost an hour to be served, staff a little unsure of the menu, and the temperature in the place was on the cold side. Will definitely come back to try the other menu items in a couple of weeks after the opening pains are ironed out and update the review.
